Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: gram4020
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of times before with my wife. This time I was with a friend. We had 2 economy rooms. These were small,but very clean and comfortable. Apart from the bed which I found super comfortable, I notice that the TVs have been updated & there are now more channels available. This was appreciated when we got in early one evening. This is an ideal place for those people who will not have a car. The Old Town Transit Station is less than 5 minutes walk away. From there you can get the trolleys and buses. They're fast, convenient and good value. I love that this place, which has always been great, doesn't rest on it's laurels. They constantly make improvements, which although small, really make a difference. All this and their really genuinely helpful and friendly staff, are what makes me come back everytime I'm in San Diego. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Luv_2_Trav748
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Old Town Inn. This is the 3rd year that we've used this Hotel and will use Old Town Inn again. The staff was very accommodating to every need that we had.The hotel was very clean. The continental breakfast was great. The pool was clean and made a nice atmosphere to relax in. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a great bang for your buck and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: JLOjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed a fri/sat night to see SeaWorld. The hotel was just a quarter mile from the Amtrak station and the bus to SeaWorld. And a short walk to "Perry's", a fab breakfast diner. The hotel room (#248) was clean and bed was comfortable. The room was very small, but fine for a short stay. Negatives: not enough plugs for charging two cell phones without unplugging lights. Also, one lamp's cord ran UNDER THE MATTRESS in order to reach the plug, which seemed to be asking for trouble. We called the desk once for an extra pillow, and it arrived in 1minute. Very attentive staff. Pool was nice, too. In all, a good choice for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: demayumi
Reviews.Content: We've stayed 3 nights at the Old Town Inn. Really convenient location - 10min driving to Sea World, 20min driving to San Diego Zoo, and a walking distance from Old Town (Mexican colonization, really interesting to visit or to have a dinner next to the hotel). Our room was comfortable, simple but well furnished and clean. Good breakfast with fruits, yogurt, cereals, waffle and etc. Friendly reception and it's possible to buy tickets to the parks with discounts. Really worthy for money, don't hesitate to book a room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel as long as you are driving”
Reviews.Author: Papindi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Town Inn for 5 nights in a double queen suite - the room was very spacious and surprisingly quiet being on the highway - the staff were lovely and the included breakfast great - I would recommend the hotel but only to those who are driving. We were not driving - when making initial enquiries we asked about travelling from the hotel to Sea World,San Diego Zoo and the Safari Park and were told it is located within easy reach of these as the transit station is across the road. Not being familiar with San Diego this sounded perfect. It wasn't - the hotel is not located in an area that lends itself to walking - to be frank it is not a salubrious area - when I walked in the early evening to the liquor store to buy milk I was offered a lift by a dodgy character. Travelling on public transport from the hotel was problematic - while the transit station - trolleys and MTS buses is a 5 minute walk across the highway - the wait for buses was long and even longer and very frustrating if trying to make connections - on the weekends the 150 bus the hotel had recommended taking did not even operate - we wasted a lot of holiday time waiting for transport - we did not make the Safari park which was 2 1/2 hour trip to get to by public transport from the hotel - we ended up taking taxis to get around which were quit blocks away to buy supplies - it sold very basic provisions - we really needed a car to get further afield to a proper supermarket so our kitchen was not utilised. Another disappointment was the free wi fi which did not work from our room -staff told us that iPads were a problem with their system and their tech support told me to call Apple as there was probably something wrong with my iPad. I would recommend Old Town Inn for travellers with cars - for those without I would stay downtown for a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TXTXKay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in March at the Old Town Inn. We chose it because of reviews we had read on Trip Advisor. We were 100% thrilled with our decision to stay there and not unhappy with anything there. The staff was cheerful, helpful in any way they could be and made our stay very pleasant! The breakfast they had was excellent and above most of the other places we had been to over the years. A delightful surprise was that they had "real" plates and silverware, instead of the usual flimsy foam & plastic! Coffee in lobby all day and a fire going in the fireplace, made you feel right at home. We will stay there again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jenn M
Reviews.Content: I've been to all the expensive resort hotels in the county and this was the best value for the money! The staff is very friendly and helpful, our room was spacious, clean and comfy, and we were pleasantly surprised at the amenities usually only found in much more pricey hotels, such as a dvd player in-room, organic soap and shampoo, iron and ironing board, blow dryer, plenty of towels and washcloths, and a kitchenette in our deluxe queen studio. We had a nice breakfast every morning with the complimentary spread in the breakfast room and tea, coffee and water are available until 11pm. The only reason it doesn't get 5 circles is because of its location, which is very industrial and a little strange to maneuver in traffic, as well as a bit noisy. These things didn't really bother us, but others may find it a little off-putting. On the other hand, it is centrally located for siteseeing, getting to local attractions and airport runs. We will definitely be back for future "staycations"!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Smoofoo500
Reviews.Content: Very basic and clean rooms. Free parking. Service was excellent. Easy access to the highway to get to Balboa Park and downtown. 2 minute walk to the public transportation and to downtown Old Town. Complimentary breakfast served in the morning; pastries, fruit, hard boiled eggs, cereal, waffle maker etc. Best service I have ever had at a hotel and very affordable! I defiantly recommend this place if your looking for a basic, affordable place to stay on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton.They care for their patrons.”
Reviews.Author: Carlton S
Reviews.Content: Janet received a bad cut on her hand at the trolley station. When we got to the inn, the ladies at the counter provided us with supplies to patch her up and were very concerned for her. She's doing well now thanks to them. The rooms were neat and clean. Needless to say, the next time we visit San Diego, my home town, we will be staying at the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: qaxalot
Reviews.Content: If you can get over the location (sort of industrial area), you will be very surprised. The hotel is clean and neat, and the bathroom is huge. We got a 2 queen bed room, and the bathroom area has 2 sinks (one in the toilet/shower area, one outside, in the dressing area). Very handy when traveling with a family and everyone's always needing to use the sink! Also, the dressing area is useful for getting dressed when others are still asleep (it's sort of around a corner, so the light doesn't glare into sleeping people's eyes. Nice breakfast too. Very convenient to Old Town, the malls and Mission Bay. Suggestion for the management - can you put in taller showerheads/curvy shower head extenders? Would make a big different to taller folks! A/C unit was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ahbbyluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and eager to help. The individual who checked us in, I can't recall her name, was "in training" according to her badge. She was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. We arrived a little bit early and she immediately radioed housekeeping to see if our room was ready, pointed out coffee,tea and water in the lobby and movies we would be able to borrow at no cost. She also pointed out the fact that we could purchase discount tickets to the San Diego Zoo from the Inn and provided us with a map of the area. We never would have known she was "in training" except that it was on her badge - she is clearly beyond this. The room was very clean, the grounds well taken care of. The bathroom was nicely partitioned off from the rest of the room. The sink area was seperate form the toilet and shower area, which also had another sink in there as well. The pool, although small would be ample enough to cool off and for kids to have some fun. We didn't get to enjoy it because the weather was cool. The breakfast each morning was adequate. Nothing fancy but a good start to the day. The individual in charge of replenishing everything was a hard worker and really hustled - all with a smile on her face. The only drawbacks, the reasons for a four rating and not a five, were traffic noise, location and a strangely low shower head. The traffic noise was easily fixed by turning on the fan in our room - the white noise silenced the traffic. Not a big deal but if white noise doesn't work for you... The location was kind of strange but not bad. If you are planning on driving to see things not a big deal. We actually preferred this to staying in busy downtown. The shower head was placed extremely low. I am 5'4" and it was tough for me. Again, not really a deal breaker but if you are really tall.... Where else can you stay in the San Diego area for this price that includes breakfast, parking, DVD's and a friendly, helpful staff? We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A really great value and a nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SMRB210
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a few occasions and have been consistently impressed with the overall setting and friendly staff. This motel offers a clean and fresh atmosphere and great value it is easily accesses by both car and rail I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: poseur247
Reviews.Content: I took a 2 year hiatus from SD and was extremely pleased that instead of going down hill, the Old Town Inn remained the same great place. The breakfast area has moved, but other than that, visitors will notice nothing different. Old Town Inn has gorgeous flowers around the entire property. It is on Pacific Highway, but the traffic noise is minimal. The breakfast is awesome! They have waffles, eggs, cereal, fruit, bagels, coffee...very expansive. The only negative was that the bungalows had thin walls. I think if your neighbor was a night owl and you weren't it could be bad, but other than that, this place is great!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend old town san Diego to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: cbarbie76
Reviews.Content: First of all I have loved san Diego since I was a kid, I live in las Vegas and now my fiancee and I go there often(especially with him being in navy) anyway in Dec. 2011 we went to san Diego for a football game and ended up going to old town 3 Days later, they have a little something for everyone, museums, great Resturants(with great service, shopping, and one of the most historical haunted houses(whaley house). We walked around for hours and we are thinking about going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: efqm
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel,very friendly and excellent value. All staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. Good location as we did not have a car,near to trolly bus and Old Town and reception staff were happy to give us directions or order us a taxi. Good selection for breakfast and enjoyed having coffee and tea on tap in the reception area. Our room was very large and clean with comfortable beds. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Elusivedream50
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled with family (all adults) this was the perfect stay in every way, rooms ( adjoining) very clean beds very comfortable, made use of laundry facilities available. Breakfast was very good highly recommend the waffles. Pool area very nice, front staff were very helpfull. this hotel is perfectly located to accessing public transport. The trolley sevice is a short 5 minute walk from hotel, San Diego has a very good public transport service available, the front desk are able to provide info on how to get around, we found this extremly helpful. All the transport drivers are very friendly and will go out of their way to assist tourists. Many excellent restaraunts with in a 10 minute walk. Must try the Mexican food at one of the many restaurants in Old Town, there are many other types of food to choose from as well. All food is very well priced. I would definately stay at Old Town Inn again, I highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: framinles
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and chose the hotel for its location. We had a rehearsal dinner in La Jolla and a wedding on Coronado. We knew that we also wanted to visit Old Town and the Gas Lamp area. The hotel was perfectly located for access to freeways and one could easily walk to Old Town. We were happy to have free parking, in a safe and well lighted parking lot. The hotel is spotlessly clean and maintained. The staff were friendly and always helpful. Breakfast is included and is a nice touch. We chose toasted whole wheat bagel and a freshly hard boiled egg, washed down with OJ and a cup of tea. There were choices of cereals and waffles as well. A nice way to start the door at no extra charge. We highly recommend this hotel for a perfect stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms a bit cramped and dated.”
Reviews.Author: dukkandpooh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first portion of our vacation based largely on the reviews we'd read on Trip Advisor. Our first impression was a positive one, when we checked in with Anna, who was very friendly and helpful. When we arrived at the room we were assigned, it was a huge letdown. Room 111 sits at the corner of two buildings, with absolutely no light making it into the room and a location right next to a storage room that the maids use. The rooms were very dated and very cramped for 4 people. The vanity is outside the bathroom which is nice, but the lighting is poor and the ventilation leaves much to be desired. It was difficult to keep the room at a pleasant temperature due to the humidity which seemed to be in large part due to poor ventilation in the bathroom. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the internet service was great. The pool and pool area was beautiful, with lots of colorful flowers and palms. Everything is kept immaculately clean. There was a laundry facility near the pool which we did use, and everything worked well (though the PacMan machine ate some of my coins!) The breakfast was great, and again, a lot of attention was paid to keeping the room stocked and clean. There was one front desk worker who was there in the late afternoons who was not particularly pleasant, but our interactions with her were limited enough to not have to bring it to the attention of anyone else. The location is great and central to so many things, though it does require some creative driving skills at times to get into and out of the hotel itself. I am not sure I would stay at this particular hotel again, but I don't regret our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTITL
Reviews.Content: This is the third or fourth year we stay at this hotel and we will continue to come back when in San Diego to take the kids to the zoo, Sea World, Coronado, La Jolla, etc. It's affordable, clean, and great customer service. All employees are super nice. There is a continental breakfast and last time we were there they had a large spread of food. You can go from healthy hard-boiled eggs to not-so-healthy waffles with syrup. You can reserve a big room or small room. We've been in both, and both were great experiences. It all depends on the size of your group. It's walking distance from Old Town. You are around the corner from Subway, Chipotle, Target and all other type of convenient places. There is a pool too, but we have never used it. When we have stayed at this hotel, we have always left early in the morning to our day activities and come back really late to just go to bed. I have already recommended this place to family and friends that were looking for a budget hotel and they were happy too.

Reviews.Title: “clean,inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: ajwandyj
Reviews.Content: motel was nice,clean,hotel staff was friendly and knowlegable.metro and old town was in walking distance.short commute to everything by rail

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, simple and clean...”
Reviews.Author: Jeff W
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in March 2012. Hotel was simple, convenient and clean which was exactly what we were looking for. Price was reasonable as we booked months ahead. Breakfast was decent for it's class. Free WiFi was a bit spotty in many areas and going up and down. Location is very near to most shopping and food areas. I'd stay again. Reception was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of strange location, but very convenient, spotless, great breakfast and the pool was heated enough to swim in March”
Reviews.Author: sorgec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my family in March. It is very close to everything, but the location is a little different, not a bunch of hotels but sort of semi warehouses. You can walk to old town in about five minutes. The staff was so organized, we asked for directions to the nearest grocery store and were given a printed sheet with directions to pretty much everything you might need. Also suggested some great restaurants. Room was clean, breakfast was nice (bagels/muffins/make own waffles/juice/hardboiled eggs/cereal/ toast, fruit and so on) I was very pleased that the pool was heated enough for my kids to swim in March, it was a great way to wind down after a long day at Midway and the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget, great location, friedly staff”
Reviews.Author: bpo-spam
Reviews.Content: We were staying for a couple of days in the Old Town Inn in San Diego. The location is great as you can simply walk to the Old Town with its restaurants without the need for a car. The connection to the city Ctr is good and frequent too - but we had a car and did not use the train. The room we were in had two queen size dbl beds, was spacious and clean. The rooms get some noise, mainly through neighbors, not so much from street. Sometimes the train is blowing its horn and that can be heard but is no different to Downtown San Diego where that happens with higher frequency. The whole location looks actually quite neat but is set in an industrial environment. If you can ignore the surroundings, this is a nice place to be. The Inn has a small pool which looks clean (we never used it though) Free wireless at reasonable speed. The breakfast was basic with toast, muffins, eggs, jam, some cheese spread, orange juice, some (canned?) fruits, coffee and tea. But the self-baked waffles were great! They could have used maple syrup instead of browned sugar though. There are always fresh fruits available (also outside breakfast hours): apples and oranges. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. On checkout we were offered a 10% discount if we returned. All in all a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great value if you don't need elegance.”
Reviews.Author: PDXConservative
Reviews.Content: They delivered for the price. The room was dated but clean. Excellent staff with good advice and very friendly. Free parking and super close to Sea World (5 minute drive). The morning breakfast was a nice treat. You won't beat if for the price. We paid $88 all in for a double queen with kitchen. Nice little pool area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneCaz
Reviews.Content: Our family of four enjoyed our stay at the Old Town Inn. We had a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The suite was spacious and clean with a full kitchen. Breakfast was provided which is always appreciated with growing boys in the family and the lobby area had a lovely sitting area with a fireplace. We walked to Old Town and drove everywhere else during our stay which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingfamily003
Reviews.Content: Don't let the location fool you. This is a great little hotel! Conveniently located to all ammenities, this hotel is a perfect little get-a-way. Breakfast is good, although the selection doesn't change, but there is more than enough to satisfy even the pickiest traveller. And free coffee all day! The kitchens are pretty sparse, so don't try to cook anything too much. The WiFi is pretty much useless (can rarely log on), but these are pretty small concerns. The hotel staff and the service more than makes up for these. We'll be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location!”
Reviews.Author: shoppingdiane03
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nites. I got a free upgrade to my original booking. The breakfast that is included is really great: hardbolied eggs, fresh fruits, toast, bagels, muffins, danish, waffles, (3) cold cereal choices, oatmeal, orange juice, peanut butter, cream cheese, butter, jelly--all the extras; and of course coffee, tea. The room was very clean.. The location is wonderful--a very short walk to Old Town. Equally short drive to local attractions. Access to trains and tours. The hotel does have a pool--but, alas, no jacuzzi. Towels are provided poolside. WiFi available. There is also a computer in the lobby for use. Free parking at the hotel. We noticed multiple hotels close to Old Town charge for parking or have on street parking only. Only complaints: a bit noisy with outside traffic & trains; thin walls also--hear others flush toilets. Bed mattress very comfortable; however, pillows too soft. They put (4) pillows on bed--all soft. There should really be a mix--(2) soft; (2) firm.VERY hospitable hotel staff! I would stay here again! Very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: HMBTraveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for the money. Great front desk staff answered many questions and went out of their way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good start to a great cruise”
Reviews.Author: mjb12556
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Old Town pre-cruise at the end of February. We stayed two nights in a jacuzzi room. The jacuzzi was huge and very clean! The room was large and clean, as was the big shower. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here if we make another trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “These people were over theaterical”
Reviews.Author: tomatocfa
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I been staying at this hotel going on 11 years and the hotel staff works extremely hard to make the guests comfortable and they also give helpful advice if you ever need it my most recentstay there. Was something unexpecting and crude. I was having a friendly conversation with the general manager when all of a sudden we were interrupted by a young couple who barged into the hotel lobby and acted totally theaterical as though they were plotting this they told her that they were blood stains on their bed and they saw a hunormus cockroach crawling in their room and they were demanding a free night at the hotel. That really turns me off that people like that think they can get away with treating these hard working employees with such disrespect ,if what they said is true I'm sure they could've approached the hotel manager at a professional level the hotel management there is really good about resolving this kind of stuff but I know a phony when I see one and this young couple really takes the Oscar no matter where I am in San Diego this hotel will always be my home away from home I mean if these people don't have money to cover their hotel bill they should at least get a price on the room and save up for it other than conning the hotel manager for a free night

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: eathanw
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service. Excellent rooms. I highly recommend the suite. It's for couples only but well worth it

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: joe geography
Reviews.Content: Friendly, accommodating staff, very economical, clean rooms, close proximity to most of San Diego, wonderful breakfast. What more could one want in a place away from home? Our favorite place in San Diego. Simply awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but noise issues”
Reviews.Author: 4 Joyful Travel
Reviews.Content: If you are sensitive to noise, this is not the place for you. If you don't mind background noise from traffic, planes, trains, the hum of the mini-fridge, and noise from the AC unit, then this is a good value for San Diego. We had a deluxe king room (#205), which was large, well lit and with pleasant decor. The bed was very comfortable, though it had stiff edges. The pillows were mushy. Our room had a large mini-fridge with freezer and a small microwave. The old-fashioned TV also had a DVD player. We had a small sofa with sagging cushions. The bathroom had a toilet, tub shower, and sink. There was a second sink with lots of counter space outside of that room. The shower head had good flow but was placed very low even for people of average height. I had to turn the knob to the maximum for hot to get barely sufficient hot water for the shower. The towels were thin and scratchy. We had some difficulty with the wifi, but generally it worked okay. The continental breakfast was crowded but the food was decent, including waffle maker, hard-boiled eggs, and fruit, along with the usual fare. It's a short stroll to Old Town and its good Mexican restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: splash's_pal
Reviews.Content: I thought Old Town Inn was a good value - clean room, nice lobby with fireplace, and friendly front desk. If you want a 5-star, fancy hotel this is not for you. But we found it very acceptable for under $100/night in San Diego - in close proximity to Old Town restaurants. One suggestion is to ask for a room away from the Pacific Highway. The traffic noise was not bad, but our room was in the middle - and we heard virtually no traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent value (and nice people, too).”
Reviews.Author: radio1100
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Old Town Inn for at least 6 years. They have always provided me with a fresh, clean, well-maintained room, comfortable bed, ample breakfast, and a wonderful staff! Their pool is in a quiet, sheltered area that allows you to relax. The Inn is a short walk to the San Diego Trolley system, and near the Airport. Old Town is also a short walk for food, drink, and entertainment. Many of the staff members are long-timers and actually make you feel like they care about you being back for another visit. Beatriz and Anna are two of the managers whom I have met and they are very proud of their establishment and its employees. I highly recommend the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, clean, friendly, and the best value!”
Reviews.Author: A A
Reviews.Content: We love this place. My family goes to San Diego a few times a year and we love Old Town Inn. It's a clean, cute Inn with a terrific continental breakfast. The location and price can't be beat. They don't charge for parking like other large hotels and the staff is super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Swinak
Reviews.Content: Nice place, good helpful staff, clean, a little out of the way, but close to public transportation, the airport & Old Town. I'm not sure I'd walk in the area at night, but we had no problems. I'd stay here again if I get back this way, probably would be better for someone with vehicle, we walked and rode bikes. My only complaints, the bed was too soft for me...and no fault of the hotel, but someone let their dog keep barking while they walked it.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home away From Home!!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey G
Reviews.Content: Right away, its easy to see that this hotel is not like the rest. From the time you pull into the parking lot, check-in at the lobby, enter your room and attend breakfast when you wake, the atmosphere is warm and welcoming with charming surroundings and friendly faces. Coming from someone who spends 30-50 nights at various chains and independently owned hotels/motels throughout the year, it's an experience that stands out as unique and a much- appreciated step outside the normal rigid hotel policies and cookie-cutter accommodations provided at other locations nearby. Its not brand-new or even high-tech, but it does cover many business-travelers needs with WI-Fi, printers and fax machines. The lived-in feel has just as much appeal as a brand new remodeled room, if you take into account in room DVD players with a library of movies in the lobby to choose from at no additional cost, flat screen TVs, and in room internet access. There is also around the clock coffee, tea and fresh fruit in the lobby that is actually yummy enough to take advantage of! The pool area offers a serene escape worth indulging in, even if you just sit in a lounge chair with a book and enjoy your reflection. I really cant say enough positive things about this property and would recommend it, without hesitation, to anyone looking for a place to stay that can appreciate nostalgic charm and hospitable surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit at Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPam
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 6 nights at the Old Town Inn in San Diego. It's across the street from the Old Town Historic Park, so we walked there a few nights to visit the museums, shops and great Mexican food. We also were able to attend a play at the theatre there. The price was right - $71 with a AAA discount. It's very convenient to the airport - about 15 minutes down the road. Despite being on Pacific Highway, the room was very quiet. The room itself was on the small side, but very comfortable and clean. The towels were thin, but plentiful. I liked their green iniative - the ability to reuse towels, and they had a recycling bin in each room so you could recycle paper, plastic, glass, etc. The continental breakfast was great - very fresh. Oatmeal, cereal, bagels, danish, muffins, make your own waffles, fruit, coffee/tea/juice. There was a heated pool, which looked very clean. Unfortunately, the weather was on the cool side, so we didn't partake of it. I would definitely stay there again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic "economy" room”
Reviews.Author: JacarandaSpirit
Reviews.Content: Selected this motel based on other reviews and to be fair, was told that the regular rooms were sold out and only an economy room was available. The room was in what seemed to be the original part of the motel, most likely built in the 1940's. The room was very small, with cheap furniture and an uncomfortable bed - you turn the closet light on by pulling a string! But it was very clean,the tiny bathroom had been updated, we were able to bring our dog and it was very inexpensive. The breakfast room and breakfast itself was very good and the lobby and pool area were nice enough. Maybe I would have been happier with one of the newer rooms? I was disappointed in that you really could not walk to Old Town - this motel is located in an industrial area across from the transportation center and I would not have felt safe walking to Old Town from there. We just drove down to SD for my boyfriend's, daughter's birthday dinner and just spent one night, so it was o.k. If you want an inexpensive and very basic room where you can bring your dog and have a decent breakfast - this place is for you. If you are on holiday and want to stay somewhere nice and updated, or within walking distance to Old town, I would pay a little more and choose someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “I would have given less stars”
Reviews.Author: BeaForoni
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give an average 3 stars, but my traveling companion wanted to give 5 stars, splitting the difference we have 4. All the glowing reviews are true. The place is clean and the people were nice. My concerns: First, the smell of my room. Very body odor-ish. And not in a good way. I would have asked for a refund soley on this, but my friend asked that I give it a chance. I ran the a/c unit constantly along with the bathroom vent and soon the smell was not noticable, until the maid turned it off one afternoon. Next, the television. Most don't go to a motel to watch TV, but I like it in the morning and before bed. The TV was way too small for the size of the room. How long have tube-style TVs been obsolete? I paid for the upgraded room, maybe they should have an upgraded TV. Noise is a problem. Not in the room with the windows closed and the a/c running, but still a problem. The highways, the sirens, the planes and the helicopters, maide sitting out by the pool headache producing. And the pool. There was one lonely child who wanted to swim. His mother let him swim if other people were by the pool. Excuse me! It is not my duty to watch your kid. Complain, complain, complain. I don't mean to. The location is good. The housekeeping is excelent, even if they don't speak the language. The parking is free. The bed was as good as any I ever laid in. The WiFi worked. The breakfast was OK. I felt safe. The price is reasonable. One could do worse, and one would have to look hard to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was smooth”
Reviews.Author: KesslerKentucky
Reviews.Content: Old town is one of my favorite spots you can have home made torteas and great mexican food walk the area and visit the historical sights of sandiego this location is wounderful and loads of comfort close tot he airport and down town seaport village. Ive staued here at least three times and enjoyed each visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly staff, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: GusnFran
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is a great example of what an older facility can be. It is well maintained with lovely landscaping, excellent service at great rates. Close to the airport, trolley system and the Old Town area this is a find.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Old Town Inn”
Reviews.Author: housefrau99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at the Old Town Inn the first week of January 2012. I was pleasantly surprised. The property was well kept, included an extended breakfast and was very close to Old Town. There was a small pool but we did not use it. You could park in front of your room which I liked. If we did not stay here we probably never would have known Old Town existed.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home!”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose Old Town Inn to celebrate out 15th Wedding Anniversary. I was looking for the exact "treat" for this occasion. From the first moment of voice contact with Rebecca at Old Town Inn's front desk, I knew this was our place. It turned out to be a Perfect 10! A "Homey" clean, friendly atmosphere. The jacuzzi suite was "Paradise in a Room." Our entire experience was wonderful. And the price was extremely fair. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to experience what a hotel should feel like. Thanks to everyone at Old Town Inn for contributing to a "Perfect" 15 year celebration of our 15 years of a glorious marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn due to its location near airport and price. The property greatly exceeded our expectations. The rooms were spotless and roomy. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will stay here again on our next visit to San Diego. Everywhere we would want to visit is nearby, and the trolley is just across the street. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Virgiliana
Reviews.Content: My husband had to work in SD for a week, and I tagged along. We chose the Old Town Inn because it was within the moderate price range his company allowed and offered a kitchenette (nice for a somewhat extended stay). The room was clean, comfortable, fairly spacious, and had a mini fridge, microwave, sink, range--we requested the kitchen supplies, which were just about anything you could ask for, including toaster. (Eating in the room is such a great way to save money on food and eat more healthily.) When we first got to our room and found it was very dark, we asked if we could change to a sunnier room, which the manager(? not sure--the woman at the front desk) did her best to remedy--the room she put us in got more natural light, but was still pretty dark. Major pros: - My husband is picky about hotel beds, but he loved the mattress. Says he would return just for the comfy bed. - Staff was friendly and helpful - ample continental breakfast included waffles, cereal, bagels, pastries, fruit, hardboiled eggs - five-minute walk from Old Town State Historic Park - grounds were pleasant, well kept (I enjoyed lounging poolside--the water was warm, though I didn't go in) - cozy, welcoming lobby with armchairs and DVD library - internet cable in room (safer than Wi-Fi) Cons: - even the room we were transferred to was still pretty dark (maybe because all the rooms that have kitchenettes are in the corner of the building, and the rooms that get light don't have kitchenettes?) - we had some trouble trying to fiddle with the termostat to get it the right temperature - the neighborhood felt, to me, kind of unsafe for pedestrians (fast moving traffic with nothing between the sidewalk and the road), though there were plenty of people walking around Overall, we had a great stay and would gladly come back--seems like a great value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it...,”
Reviews.Author: Gogogirl45
Reviews.Content: for the price! I just returned from a week in San Diego. This motel has definitely been around for a long time, but it was spotless, the breakfast was just as it is at any chain motel--waffles,fruit,etc., helpful staff, and right across the street from Old Town and a major bus and trolley center, just as they advertise. I was in an economy room, because of the extraordinary rate, and I think I would choose the more expensive rooms next time--only because mine was in a different section,a bit removed from the main complex. I am sure the rate was because of room location and it is a bit off-season, but my flight from NC and room were slightly under $1000...not bad!! Earplugs might be a good idea for light sleepers...some plane noise and traffic sounds early in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay and a great value”
Reviews.Author: VeredMBS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the old town inn for 5 days in January 2012. we went to this hotel because of positive reviews it was getting on tripadvisor. The room was always clean, the staff was very welcoming and helpful and the location is awesome! just a drive of 15 minutes to sea world. san doego zoo and more! The only issue we had we this hotel is its WIFI. the WIFI was free of charge but not very good, on our first night we changed rooms because we couldnt connect to it at all. after that night, we could connect to it only in a certain point in the room and it got disconnected alot.

Reviews.Title: “Safe place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: captainmidwest
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Ample parking, computer available in lobby and easy access to airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a week in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SquishyCupcake
Reviews.Content: All in all a good place to stay in San Diego. Good Value. PROs - Friendly accomodating staff that do all they can to help (Seems a very good culture - we stayed in 10 different hotels during our trip and housekeeping at Old Town were the only ones to write a thank you note for their tips) - High quality breakfast for a "continental" breakfast - No road noise, no airport noise - Located quite a way from downtown - Area is fine for walking around in the day and early evening - supermarkets and wide range of shops nearby - convenient to freeways, shops - Lobby has continuous coffee available - Rooms spacious and clean CONs - Breakfast area doesn't have many tables and will fill quickly in busy periods - Depot out the back starts operations early in the morning, usually with a thumping of the metal doors - Located quite a way from downtown - Probably wouldn't walk around the area late at night - Wifi only works well in the lobby, is unreliable elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Crystal031
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We have been coming here for the past 4 years for the charger game. The staff is friendly and remembers us from year to year. It is very clean, great free breakfast, spacious rooms and bathrooms. It is across the street from the trolley station, but not noisy. Within Walking distance to Old Town with some great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: astronomer-at-large
Reviews.Content: Stayed again in Dec 2011, and found it just as good. Easy to park and good location close to freeways and to the Old Town area of restaurants etc. Comfortable spacious room with free wifi, coffee maker, etc. Good free breakfast. The only slight drawback is that it isn't absolutely quiet at night. It's not far from the freeway and the railroad, and one does get some noise, but it never kept us awake. We certainly didn't notice any noise from other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a clean comfortable motel”
Reviews.Author: kad911
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night when we could not change our flight. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. They let us borrow some movies for free and arranged transportation to the airport on Sunday. The price was very reasonable for such a nice place. It was even a short walk from the transit center and Old Town State Park and tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location !!”
Reviews.Author: Doolish
Reviews.Content: This is definitly the exception to that well know rule about location. We booked this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor and were a bit nervous about some of the negative points raised by previous visitors. To those that have given this hotel poor marks I would say ' get a life'. No its not a luxury hotel nor is it situated in the heart of San Diego but based on pure value for money it has to be amongst the best in the whole area. Location - yes its abit out on a limb but not as bad as some make out. There is an ample car park and the site looks and feals secure. There is a five minute walk to the Tram/Bus/Coaster station and yes you have to cross a busy road but there are traffic lights! San Diego Old Town is a few minutes past the station and has many shops/ eateries. A 24 hour pass on the tram is $5 so you are easily able to get almost anywhere in San Diego at a minimal cost. As for the hotel and its staff - you cannot fault it. Spotlessly clean and everything you would expect from a hotel of this size. The Breakfast was great too. Many people have raised an issue over noise - yes there is a freeway nearby as well as the train but it was not noticable in the room. The airport is also close by and whilst we didn't notice it on the first day it was noticable on the second - probably something to do with wind direction. However it was not as serious an issue as others would make out. All in all a great stay - great value - nice staff - would certainly stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Sandra N
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at Old Town Inn from the airport we wondered where on earth we had come to. A hotel in the middle of industrial area. It proved to be a great location.! The trolley, bus, and train station were just across the road as well as Old Town. We were able to catch the trolley everywhere in San Diego for $5.00 each all day.Great value. Old Town Inn rooms were nice and clean and spacious. A very nice continental breakfast was provided each day which was included in the room rate. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and so very helpful. If you don't want to stay right in the city this would be the next best option.

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Aura F
Reviews.Content: If you want great service, a lovely continental breakfast, a very comfortable room at an extremely reasonable rate, this is the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at the edge of Old Town”
Reviews.Author: gene-parmesan
Reviews.Content: We traveled across the USA by train and stayed at many places, and the Old Town Inn was our family's favorite. It ticks all of the boxes: great room with full kitchen, nice swimming pool, free continental breakfast, great location with good transportation links, and friendly staff. The hotel's location is a bit unusual, right on Pacific Highway. It's surrounded by commercial property but it doesn't feel hemmed in. But this location is advantageous too. It's a very short walk to the Old Town transportation hub, convenient both for buses, trains, and trams. We traveled by Amtrak and the Pacific Surfliner sometimes stops at Old Town Station, which is even more convenient to get to the hotel. At the other side of the transport station is historic Old Town, which was a delight to visit -- all of this is within walking distance of the hotel. In reading some of the reviews we were concerned about accessing the hotel by foot when it's right on the highway, but this wasn't a problem at all -- there are traffic lights to safely cross the highway and get over to the transport station. Our room was very nice; large and complete with a full kitchen. You can request a full set of cooking supplies for free, if you want to make some meals in your room. The hotel also has DVD players in the rooms, and you can freely borrow from a large selection of DVD's in the hotel lobby. Our kids also enjoyed the pool, which is large and a nice temperature. No hot tub, unfortunately. The continental breakfast is also nice -- fruits, cereals, pastries, toast, as well as a couple of waffle makers which is always a family favorite. The staff were great; very helpful when we had requests or needed assistance. I can hardly think of a negative thing about this hotel; for our family it was perfect and it made for a lovely stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I tried to give 4 1/2 stars but it wouldn't let me! The service was excellent and our room was very nice! Loved the fireplace, the huge tub, and walk in shower. I also enjoyed the fact that the hotel had complimentary DVD's to borrow for the evening. The continental breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly. It is a great location for walking to the main street in Old Town. The only negative I would give is that although it's convenient that the trolley is close by, the area at night on the way to the main street in Old Town seems a bit shady. Other than that, loved our stay and would definitely stay there again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: spsch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days to visit old town San Diego and Sea World. It was a perfect location, away from the traffic and parking problems of downtown and walk-able to Old Town park and restaurants. Room was comfortable and clean although nothing special. Easy to get to Sea World and other parks in the area. It is surrounded by highways and not much else around it until you cross the street and go under the highway to get to Old Town. Breakfast was pretty standard fare for this type of hotel but it did have fresh fruit. Front office staff were friendly and helpful with directions. They also had discounted tickets to Sea World and other local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CRtravelerDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. Older rooms but clean, staff was fabulous and the location and price was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value rooms with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Liztdunedin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for 3 nights. We had room 311, which was very spacious, as it had two rooms separated by class doors. There were 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 children, so we had 2 adults and 2 children in the bedroom and then 1 child slept in the lounge on the pull out sofa. The rooms were very clean and tidy and as we were on a corner, the room was very quiet except for in the early hours of the morning when the skip/rubbish bin belonging to the company next door was emptied. That was very noisey but only lasted for a few minutes. The location was fantastic for getting around the main sight seeing areas and activities of San Diego. We used the pool everyday, which was a lovely setting and open until later into the evening, as it was summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: KniteRiter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn due to its proximity to Qualcomm Stadium, as we were headed there for a Chargers game. As we were approaching the address on our navigator, we got a little concerned as the neighborhood is questionable. But the Inn is like a little oasis, the landscaping is immaculate and the buildings all look beautiful. We arrived early and our room was ready, so they let us check in. Anna at the front desk was extremely helpful and gave us the best advice. We quickly figured out to check with her before making any decisions, as she had the most accurate information we could ask for! She was the one who told us to take the trolley to the stadium, so as not to hassle with parking. She knows where everything is and gives great directions. The Inn is a quick walk to the trolley station, which will take you anywhere in San Diego. It is also extremely close, just a block, to Old Town. The rooms aren’t fancy, but they are clean and comfortable. They have a very nice pool. The lobby has a computer you can use to access the internet. They also have DVD players in the rooms and free movies you can check out. The only complaint we could think of, was the continental breakfast was not anything to write home about, barely passing. The shining star would have to be the amazing service you’ll receive. We would definitely return to the Old Town Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glen953
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was clean with plenty of room for 2 people. The location of this hotel was very convenient and I highly recommend it to anyone traveling to San Diego for Sea World, Zoo or just sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Mycuppajava
Reviews.Content: Not luxurious but it doesn't have the $$$ price. Our needs were very well taken care of and it was quite enjoyable...esp. breakfast around the beautiful pool. Very close to transportation which is a very large plus. I would stay there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: S P
Reviews.Content: It is a nice place to live for a week long stay.Very nice,well secured & clean room with good facilities.Homely atmosphere & friendly hotel members with good helping attitude.Hotel is Very near to public transport facility to go to down town & other places.Hotel front desk crew are very helping & my special thanks to them. SSP-India

Reviews.Title: “Good value in SD, neighborhood slightly iffy”
Reviews.Author: sukhoi_584th
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is a great value compared to how expensive so many places in San Diego are. It's clean, the rooms are well maintained, and the free breakfast is decent enough. It's nice and close to the Old Town Transit Center, but beware the general area has some iffy people loitering around at times. The hotel grounds are very well maintained, and the pool looked pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: kka57
Reviews.Content: Because the hotel is in a random type location. I felt a little concerned coming back late. The hotel is well lit. I would have appreciated security. It is a busy little hotel. Cute grounds. Could be traffic noisy, I requested a quiet room they were more than accommidating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large motel complex although a bit isolated!”
Reviews.Author: Lee M
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place with comfortable clean room. Very nice breakfast room near reception with better than average complimentary breakfast. The location is a bit isolated although you are near the "trolley" stop which takes you to downtown San Diego. There is a good liquor store short walk from motel (Walk under freeway overpass).

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: ohsmartymarty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September. The location is slightly random as it is just off a main freeway type road, but also very close to public transport and the old town area of the city. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and friendly. DVD's, books and games available in the lobby and we took advantage of this, and it was a great bonus. Breakfast was good, cereal, fruit, bread, waffles, tea, coffee - all that you could ask from an included in price buffet breakfast. The rooms were clean and spacious, although we did notice the that walls and floors seemed slightly thin, although thankfully are neighbors were quiet so noise was not an issue. We did not notice any noise from the road or airplanes. There is a pool and also laundry facilities if you wish to do any washing. Great location to avail of local sights and public transport, and lovely hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value And Super Staff”
Reviews.Author: dmcronin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times when visiting San Diego. The hotel is a four minute walk to Old Town which is a wonderful family attraction. This hotel includes a nice breakfast and has an simple outdoor swimming pool. The rooms are not fancy but I don't want fancy. I want a convenient, safe, inexpensive location and this is what It get here. The location itself is somewhat isolated except for its proximity to Old Town and Sea World. If you want to visit downtown/zoo/etc. then you might want to stay at another location. I have sometimes split my stay between two hotels. The staff is wonderful and will advise you on any directions, attractions, etc. They happily let me leave luggage for late departure, etc. and are always around to help out. The room cleaners are also wonderful and efficient.I always feel safe and welcome and will come back yet again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Friedly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roque
Reviews.Content: The room was fine and clean, the staff was very friendly and the location was OK, its in the middle between the San Diego Zoo and Sea World so for us was great. The breakfast is basic, waffles, eggs, apples, bread and bagels with cream cheese and jam, cereal, coffee, etc… What we did not like was that we were able to hear the conversation from another room (in addition we heard airplanes passing not very loud though), the room had some musty odor and one of the beds was lopsided, none of this was serious so we didn’t mention anything. In general, we only wanted an hotel to sleep and the place was clean which was enough for us. We have stayed in more sophisticated hotels for same or lower price

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bphawk64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn two nights and we very happy with our stay there. The hotel is clean, located very close to the entrance to Old town and is a very good value for the price we paid. It's also has very easy access to major highways, downtown, most San diego attractions, the beach, etc. Overall very nice hotel and better than the price would indicate. As with most hotels there were pluses and minuses but at the Old Town Inn the pluses outweighed the minuses by quite a bit. The bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable, so comfortable that I found myself looking for the brand in case I wanted to buy the same for at home. We walked to Old Town and it was quite close and seemed safe enough. Breakfast was complimentary and was pretty good. The pool was a bit small but sufficient and I hardly ever saw anyone else there. There was free wi-fi service and it worked well and although not lightning fast it was more than sufficient for just web searching. The bathroom was also seperate from the the sink area which was a nice setup and provided a bit extra space. The major negative to the hotel is that the walls seemed thin and we could hear our neighbors talking and hear their tv as if there was a party next door. It wasn't terrible but I would imagine this wouldn't sit well with some people. Our tv also had "issues" and didn't always work correctly and was also set up to be watched from the couch in the room and was difficult to see from the bed. I moved the armoire it was in so it could be viewed from the bed which easily solved that issue. Overall the Old Town Inn was a nice hotel and nicer than other hotels in the same price range. I would not hesitate to stay there again in the future. I have seen comments about it's location and it's true that the area is a bit industrial looking but it seemed perfectly fine and seemed quite safe.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: doesntitmatter
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well-kept, unpretentious, close to the airport - an excellent choice for my short trip. You definitely want to have a car, as the neighborhood isn't particularly walkable, but I had absolutely no complaints otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “We were very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 1fatrat2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Old Town Inn for three days last week. WE WERE VERY PLEASED WITH OUR STAY. The bed was comfortable, the room was spacious and CLEAN! The staff was very helpfull. My wife asked for extra towels and had them within minutes. Breakfast was simple but filling and ran for 4 hours. This was convienient for both early and late risers. Our cost for 3 nights with AARP discount was under $300.00. And parking was free. Try downtown, the Gaslamp and other areas where parking runs $15-25 a night. This left us with more to spend on other things, which really pleased the wife. I cannot give the Inn a five rating because of where it sits. It is in an industrial area and that might turn some people off. However it is close to many major San Diego attractions and is a 5 minute walk from the transit center. Be sure to map out where you are going. As I mentioned before, parking can be hard to find and expensive. A trolley can save you some time and money. We will probably go back to San Diego next year. We will most likely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: krybra
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Hotel. Excellent Service, Friendly, quiet and impecable clean. I totally recomended.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Ruksana M
Reviews.Content: We chose this Inn after finding it in the Rough Guide to California - after a long drive from Flagstaff, AZ, we were looking for a 2 night stay. When we arrived we were permitted to see the room and we decided to stay 3 nights - the place just had a lovely feel to it. We had a great time, chilling by the pool (which was clean and had lots of pretty flowers and plants around) Breakfast was a bonus, really generous with pastries, waffles boiled eggs and cereals, staff were really helpful - better service than you'd receive in a motel and the price here was really good too. Can't fault the place at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Brad M
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Old Town Inn several times and are always satisfied. It has free parking, free breakfast, and a nice pool to swim in. The convenient location can't be beat! Only minutes away from Sea World, downtown, Seaport Village, Point Loma, etc...There is also a nice selection of DVD's available that you can bring back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice because of the value and location. You can walk to Old Town and it is a short drive to the zoo, points downtown, and to Coronado Island. Our room was clean (a must) and the staff was friendly and helpful. It is near a railroad, but the trains did not run late in the night so it was not a problem. I would suggest getting a room in the newer part. Our room had been updated, but did lack a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Travelandenjoy
Reviews.Content: We were very happy that we chose this hotel for our visit to San Diego. Its a nice little place, near to various interesting places.We had a nice room, free parking ,internet and breakfast. The staff were very helpful and gave us various maps and details.I would suggest this place to friends and I would go there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Simple. Clean. Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: nycchip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Old Town Inn for one night during our road trip along the west coast. It was a good stay over all. The room was simple, clean and comforable; the shower was excellent. The staff was very professional. Other pros are free internet, free parking and access to collection of dvds for free. Downtown is only 10 mins away but the location is not so great - across the road from some kind of processing plant and warehouse, situated in industrial part of Old Town. Having a car is a must. The bedding/sheets are a little old; not a big fan of a sheet over an old thin polyester blanket. Many hotels are switching to duvets and I hope this one does too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay! A few problems with Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: jasonmau1
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice hotel, rooms are nice, beds were comfortable and clean. The bikers that left the first morning were loud and inconsiderate but that was by no means the fault of the hotel. Breakfast was nice and fresh. (Real plates and silverware!). We purchased Zoo tickets from them at a discount (very nice). Now with the customer service problem.... I returned on my 2nd day about 1:00 pm to find that my key did not work. (I was in a bit of a hurry) When I went in the customer service person (Michele) was rude and told me that we did not have reservations and we needed to move to another room. I insisted we did have reservations and she argued with me. I told her I was in a hurry and that I needed to go. (I had tickets to a harbor cruise) She told me that I should have taken care of this earlier and it was not her problem. 15 minutes later she gave me a key an said she would make it work. I returned from our cruise and showed the new CSR (cecily) the reservation to confirm my reservation and she apologized and gave me a discount on my entire stay. Internet was a little slow. We were about 5 minutes from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay but lets not get carried away.....”
Reviews.Author: Jul1910
Reviews.Content: The room is ok and clean but not more, the pool is nice, the breakfast is "slim" but fair, the staff during the day is very helpfull and sympathetic (the night staff ( a gentleman) less). Lets say that with 35 US$ less you would feell a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, delicious breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpgirl_10
Reviews.Content: Top class rooms, very big, nice bathroom, great location of the hotel near Old Town and near public transport to San Diego Centre, also very near to SeaWorld. The buffet style breakfast was fresh and delicious, with bake-your-own waffles. Also the pool and jacuzzi where very welcome in this hot city.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff and convenient walking distance to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Lanceoak
Reviews.Content: Ovcrnight stay and enjoyed the Old Trolley tour to get acquainted with San Diego. Within easy walking distance from Old Town activities and eating establishments. Room was clean and the staff were very helpfull. Good continental breakfast to start the day. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: pkeaggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn while in San Diego for a quick get-away from the AZ heat! The Hotel was very nice and the staff very accomodating! Our room was great! We opted for the two queens with the kitchenette! we brought our dog alone (the hotel is very close to dog beach (google dog beach)). If you are looking for a place to stay in a quite area of San Diego and close to beaches, mission bay, corando island - a hotel not along the freeway (but not far from it), I highly reccomend the Old Town Inn!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice motel near Old Town SD”
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: While it is not right in the heart of Old Town, it is a quick walk across a stretch of the PCH with a pedestrian walk and then under the metro overpass right into the gates of Old Town itself. It is a bit far from the center of San Diego itself, but still easily reachable by car. Our motel room on the 2nd floor was surprisingly spacious. In addition to the fridge and microwave, our accommodations included a sofa and ample bathroom and sink space. The elevator came in handy during check-in and check-out. Parking was free but a bit crowded and tight, although the ever present monster trucks driven in by some of the other guests played a role in this. Still, it is a great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Doymo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn while in San Diego for a quick weekend get-away. It was very close to the airport which was convenient for our early departure. We were able to walk to Old Town in minutes. The room was spotless. The hotel is on a highway but we didn't hear any street noise, particularly when the air or heat is on. The breakfast was generous and well done. They even have a sweet little pool. We would recommend it and would stay again on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Katsmtzy
Reviews.Content: It's a little hotel with a good service and very clean. Great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal.”
Reviews.Author: Ritzy7
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel because of the reviews on TripAdisor and it was great. We stayed in a family suite and the room was huge. It had a little kitchen with a refrigerator and a microwave. Too bad we didn't bring any food as we could have used it, especially since the hotel is in an isolated area in Old Town San Diego. Not too many shops or restaurants around so I advise you to research for places to eat before your arrival here. Great pool and continental breakfast. Super close by to Sea World which is why we stayed here. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Best in the West and excellent for pets”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at OLD TOWN INN, San Diego, CA., for a week. This was the greatest place we have ever stayed in and we travel quite a bit. The pet friendly phrse, is exactly what you witness. The rooms are very affordable, neat, clean and spacious. If ever in San Diego, check this Inn out before trying others. This will beat any large corporate hotels. Quiet, centrally located, near everything you would want to see or do. The hospitality of their staff bets none. If you travel with pets, you will really enjoy the OLD TOWN INN. They handle you and your family, pets with your requests, information or anything else you could need. Exceptional and a true leader in Hospitality, this is what OLD TOW INN is all about. Prices cannot be beat with what is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean, convenient location - we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: AZ49858
Reviews.Content: Nice property, clean rooms, cordial staff, complimentary expanded continental breakfast in pleasant breakfast room. This motel complex is compact w/3 "wings", there's free parking (in fairly close quarters), units are vintage but comfortable, the rooms were not fancy but attractive, vanities were granite nice-looking, beds were COMFY with nice linens, ample towels, there was a nice table & 2 chairs in the room. TV reception was very fuzzy for all stations. Try to get a room away from the street if you don't want to hear road noise. Easy to get to & from, just off I-8, I-5 & Pacific Hwy. Metro bus/light rail station across the street -- we heard train honks a 2-3 times during our 3 day stay. All in all, a GOOD VALUE. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Hope we can go back...”
Reviews.Author: risingsun_77
Reviews.Content: It has been in my to do list after I back from Holiday in SanDiego. Finally, I got time to write about this great place. My wife and I are from Malaysia and we find out this great place through trip advisor. At 1st we are quite Sceptical about all the great review on this place, until we arrive this wonderful place. The Inn is very clean, tidy and evens a small tiny detail they are doing it so well. The front desk lady is very sweet. She always gives us a lot of information for all the great food we can have in San Diego. We love it so much thank you. This place is located at a very strategic location. For those who do not drive, this is the right place to stay. It is only 5 min walk to Old town Station. It was a very memorable trip, thank you......

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Couldn't be better. The price and hotel is unbeatable.”
Reviews.Author: tangles762000
Reviews.Content: I read reviews of many hotels and looked at pictures. This hotel not only looked exactly like the pictures but was even prettier than the pics if you can believe it. The staff is fabulous and I mean it. Rebecca and Anna are the best but I got to give a special shout out to Rebecca, she was so helpful and accommodating to me even when I left my laundry in the dryer before going to sea world and forgot it. She had it right behind the desk waiting for me. The pillows I had brought were not dry yet and she unlocked the laundry door so I could finish drying them. You don't need to bring your own pillows as they have at least 5 on the bed and they are comfy. She was also a nice conversational buddy at night when things were quiet. Anna was the day person and she was very busy and accommodating also. The breakfast was just what someone would need in the morning and the waffles were great. This staff works very hard in keeping this hotel clean and comfortable. All of the girls run around doing so many things, I couldn't believe how much they care about their hotel. I stayed in the economy rooms which are like a little studio apt right in front of the pool. I am very excited to go back again next year. The owners should be proud of the girls they have cuz they all care about you and your stay. I am so happy I stayed here. sometimes you look at a hotel and you find it is not what you expect, this place is more than you can ever hope to spend a small amount of money on and feel like you are in a very expensive posh hotel. Thank you all of you at Old town inn. You are all so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Near Sea World!”
Reviews.Author: CactusCrafter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn on a week long vacation to San Diego and were more than pleased with the accommodations. It was a quaint little hotel that was convenient to everything we wanted to do in San Diego. Our room had a great view of the pool with hibiscus flowers and bird of paradise all around. The continental breakfast each morning was really nice, we wish they had a few more protein offerings, but very nice to start our days off without having to spend extra money at a restaurant. The rooms are charming and the beds amazingly comfortable! Everything was very clean at this hotel. The surroundings were a bit industrial, but we did have a view of the fireworks from Sea World from the parking lot and it felt very safe. I really liked how it wasn't off the main highway like a lot of the hotels. We'll definitely recommend this hotel for anyone we know going to San Diego, in fact we already have. We're also looking forward to our next visit to the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: reymic
Reviews.Content: There was nothing fancy about the Old Town Inn, but we knew that going into it. We were going because of the other Trip Advisor reviews that said the place was clean and cheap. We were pleased with our room, it was large. Probably in need of a face lift, but that's OK. We paid $116 a night after our lobby manager reminded us that we have a discount with AAA (Thanks!). There was free parking, and we did not have trouble finding a spot each of the four nights we stayed there. The rooms were clean, the bed comfortable. Would have liked a bigger TV, but we were fine. The location was great also, it was close to freeways and driving from one part of the city to the other is really about 20 mins tops. There was a free breakfast of bagels, fruit, etc. We spent an afternoon at the pool, it was nice and quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl19745
Reviews.Content: our room was quiet clean and the staff were nice! the property had beautiful flowers. a great place for families off the beaten path. very close to seaworld and ocean beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, clean and tidy! Super friendly!”
Reviews.Author: kayotic_81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I walked in and right away, we were greeted by the front desk staff. She was friendly and helped us right away. She told us that our room was not ready (we arrived just around 2pm, and check in was at 3pm) so she offered to hold our luggage at the back, and suggested places for us to walk around and places to eat. She took out a map and showed us where to walk. There were tons of eating places just around the corner of the inn. When we got back, our room was ready. We had trouble logging in on their wifi from our laptop, so we didn't have internet for 2 nights. However, they did have a computer at the lobby for us to use. They also had a printer for our use (free of charge!). The room was tidy and we have no complaints about the room. Breakfast was good, the usual toast, cereal, boiled egg, coffee, juice etc... I would definitely go back in the future. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, ... and noise”
Reviews.Author: wdl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to rate as my sentiments about it constantly move from a 3 to 4.5 star rating. I really wanted to rate it higher, as the staff and management seem to try hard to make it right, but some of the minus keep bugging me. Here are the pluses. - First, the hotel has some of the best rates for its location. Few properties that I researched would sell rooms for its rate (about $130 for a 2 Queen deluxe suites, less if you are AAA member) that is so close to most of San Diego's major attractions. The rate includes parking, internet (well, limited) and breakfast - a continental breakfast with packed pastries/bagels, waffle machine, and boiled eggs. Breakfast is pretty decent. Items were constantly refilled, and we found no issues finding a place to sit (hotel was fairly full during our stay, judging from the occupance of the parking lot). With respect to rates, if you are an AAA member, make sure you mention that during your reservation. It is likely that the whoever is handling your reservation will ask if you are an AAA member (a plus, a hotel that offers a discounted rate on the phone). Also, the AAA rate is not mentioned in the hotel website, and the published rates do not reflect the 10% AAA discount. According the the front desk agent, what you should do is to make a note that you are a AAA member in the comments field of your online reservation. Or call in person, they are quite friendly. - The rooms are quite clean and comfortable. Well appointed and functional. I would say they tend to be on the smaller side (the deluxe 2 Queen, I mean) but it worked for our family of four. The vanity area is separated from the bathroom which is a plus. AC is an under-window unit, a bit noisy, but it works pretty well. The room had also a tv and a dvd unit, where you can check movies at the front desk. - The hotel is nicely landscaped, and the pool area, although small, is pretty nice. Another plus is the lobby, where you can help yourself with coffee and water the whole day. It also has a computer and a printer station. It is actually a nice area to hang around, and there were even some board games that you can check and play (chess, scrabble), which is what actually excited my 8-year boy quite a bit. - I believe that the best feature of this property is the location. It is actually close to everything that matters in San Diego. It is walking distance to Old Town San Diego. It is less than 10 minute drive from SeaWorld - and you don't need to hope into the freeway to get to SeaWorld, which is a plus to save some rush hour traffic. The same holds for downtown, Gaslamp quarter, marina, and Balboa park. It was a 10 minutes drive to the beaches and 20 minutes drive to La Jolla. Actually, location is one of the major reason we chose to stay at the Old Town Inn, since its proximity to SeaWorld allowed us to leave the park late afternoon so our kids could have a brief nap and we could enjoy some dinner outside the park, before heading back to watch the night shows, which we found was well worth it. Also within the location topic, there are plenty of dining options right near the property (we had thai in a mall nearby), although I think it would a bit too far to simply walk. - I should also note that the staff works pretty hard to make it right. They are quite friendly. I wasn't aware of the AAA discount until the second day of our stay. When I mentioned that, the front desk agent automatically gave us discount for the remaining nights - I didn't even need to ask (bring your AAA card, though). The morning helper was also very friendly in giving us information and directions. Now some minuses - The first, I would like to say that the Old Town Inn is basically an old motel that has received a nice face lift, furnishings, and landscapting to look it nice. It is successfully most of time.
