However, there are times that you are reminded that this is an old motel under the facade, for example, when you hear the sound of the pumbling in action early in the morning, and you know nobody is using the bathroom. We were on the first floor, so perhaps this factor is magnified. Nevertheless, it does highlight that this is an older property. - The property is quite small (which is good and bad), and so is their parking lot. To be fair, we haven't had any parking issue, even arriving late, and the hotel was fairly full. But it does give that feeling of being crowded, not to mention the need to do some maneuvering to fit into some spaces. - The location is great, but the immediate surrounding area is kinda iffy. I did not feel unsafe in the area (it is just desert, with an industrial feeling, and only runs for a block or two) but I would not stroll around outside the motel after dinner. Still, it is perfectly safe to walk during the day, as a lot of people do. - In room internet is free, but ... Well, it seems that the hotel does not have a large bandwidth, and if you do try to download something, the server will block your mac address permanently. I don't if that is what happened to us, but I was not able to access the internet after my wife used the computer, and she said the only thing she was looking was CNN. Maybe we were blocked for some accidental news streaming, I don't know. It was a bit of an annoyance, although I was able to remedy by using the lobby computer. At the end, the free perk was not actually free. - Finally, my biggest quibble is with the noise. From our room, we had an unobstructed view of an elevated portion of a freeway and, hence, the noise had an unobstructed path to our room. The noise actually arrived in the form of "white noise", but very audible. Again, it may be that our room magnified the conditions (rooms facing other directions may not be in the direct path of the noise). I also believe that the gaps between the door and the door frame (which were relatively wide) may have to do with it (sounds seem to flowing through these gaps), meaning that it may be possible to ameliorate the situation by narrowing those gaps. There were also other noises adding to the symphony, including airplanes and the aforementioned toilet flush from the upstairs neighbors. In all fairness, I should mention that I only noticed these sounds early in the morning - evenings were quite ok. Also, wife had less issues with noise - and she is the light sleeper. Also, to be clear, these issues were not deal breakers, otherwise I would not have given a 4 star rating. However, they were reminders that this actually an old motel underneath the nice facade. I thought that overall the hotel provides an excellent (probably the best) value for your money, considering its ammenities and location. It has a friendly, accommodating staff that works really hard to make it right. However, it does have issues, like noise and crowding, that keep reminding me of its old motel facet. As I said, my sentiments for its rating swings from 3.0 to 4.5, averaging 3.75, so that's why I finally decided to rate it at 4.

Reviews.Title: “I never knew it was there! Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot31310
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn on a weekend trip to San Diego. I usually stay at another hotel and I never knew about Old Town Inn until I read a review on Trip Advisor. I found the location a bit tricky to get to because there was no left turn lane on Pacific Hwy coming from the Airport, so you have to go to the next light and make a U turn. The parking lot is very tight and when full its not easy to get into a parking place. The room was nice, nothing special but looked clean. The TV was older and the tube had a burn spot in the upper left corner. The bathroom was decent, we did have a cleanliness issue on the wall, but when reported the front desk had it addressed quickly. The shower in the tub was for short people, I had to almost squat to get under the water stream and I am 6'2". The beds were comfortable and for the money it was a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was closer to Scotland! Wonderful, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtraveller066
Reviews.Content: As part of a visit to California we booked seven nights at the Old Town Inn for our stay in San Diego based purely on trip advisor reviews and we were not disappointed. We arrived to be greeted by friendly reception team who booked us into our rooms. There were five of us and we had two deluxe queen rooms (one with a handy kitchen should you need it). The rooms were very clean and fresh. The staff work extremely hard to maintain the hotel and it has a lovely welcoming atmosphere. The pool area is just perfect with beautiful landscaping and we really enjoyed relaxing there. The complimentary breakfast is ideal with cereal, fruit, pastries, eggs and cheeses - really not sure what anyone could find fault with - its fresh, well-stocked and the dining room is very airy. The hotel lounge is extremely comfortable with free access to the internet. As other reviewers have commented there is also a wide range of DVDs to hire. The staff always have a cheery word for you and were fantastic at providing information on how to get around. On top of that is the very useful laundry room! We didn't have a car for our time in San Diego and didn't need one either. The transit station is a very short, SAFE, walk away. We used the trolley and the buses to get downtown, out to the Beach and to the shopping areas all for an unbelievable low price. We travelled back late in the evening and didn't have one bit of bother. The Old Town State Historic Park is on your doorstep and a short walk in the other direction is Walgreens and other shops. This may be an "industrial" area in some people's eyes but by no means could be described as unsafe. We rarely passed another person walking (we always find this very strange about the USA!!!) . In fact we witnessed far more people we wouldn't have wanted to pass in other areas downtown surrounded by 4 and 5 star hotels! We absolutely loved our visit to California (San Francisco, Santa Barbara and San Diego) and without hesitation would recommend the Old Town Inn to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable and value for money stay in San Diego. Their customer focus is excellent and we only wish it wasn't an 11 hour flight away!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: peterhill3505
Reviews.Content: Overall we liked the Old Town Inn a lot, with a few reservations. The hotel was brightly lit, extremely clean, and well appointed. We could tell that the owner cared a lot about the hotel. Service was friendly and the room was great for our purposes. There is also a complementary breakfast, which was definitely on par with the typical 2-star hotel fare. My only reservation is the location. It's close to Old Town, but the immediate area is under a highway and very industrial. (If the hotel itself weren't bathed in light it would be a little scary.) However, it's convenient to the Sports Arena area which has plenty of shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for ten days in July. The location is terrific, with easy access to everywhere in San Diego. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and the air conditioning is excellent. Our only complaints are that internet access in our rooms was intermittent and the continental breakfast was unimaginative. Yet, this did not take away from our stay and we would definitely use the hotel again. You can't go wrong here and the prices are quite reasonable. Jeff Schrenzel, Belchertown, MA.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for us and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: upip
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, very clean accomodations and a very helpful and pleasant staff. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Content: Transferred here after my convention was over - thought I'd be coming down in the world after the convention facilities, but ended up finding it MORE comfortable, and certainly WAY better value. Friendly staff, very comfortable bed, great breakfast, free wireless, and a location only very slightly off the main drag. An excellent base from which to explore San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of So.California charm”
Reviews.Author: 4youall
Reviews.Content: I debate whether I should write a review or not because I'm not sure I want throngs of people staying at "my find". The things that impressed me were that the location is central - especially easy access for public transportation, the staff is great, and the location is beeautiful!! The price/value relationship at this inn was excellent - the value was much more than expected because you get all the details expected in higher-priced hotels. You can tell the management has done their homework and really cares about giving a great experience. A short trolley ride gets you downtown and back for $5. and the public buses leave from there to take you to LaJolla. I didn't need to rent a car, and because it was close to the airport the taxi fare did me no harm. I really look forward to staying at "my home away from home" in San Diego next time there's a reason to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: DQFamilyATL
Reviews.Content: Spent a week traveling from Seattle to San Diego with my daughter. This was the only hotel we were disappointed with during the entire trip. Checked in late (11:30 p.m.), unpacked all of our stuff into the hotel. Got ready for bed, took off our shoes and HUGE wet spot on the carpet at the foot of the bed. Decided since it was late and we had unpacked, to just wear shoes and tolerate the nastiness. Placed towels over the wet area which immediately turned brown. Reported the issue in the morning and the first comment from the employee was, "We were going to have our carpets cleaned this week but because there is a large convention in town..." When you are in the service industry, please don't make excuses, just make it right. And this excuse doesn't justify the situation anyway. Then I was told that a coffee spill had been reported in that room and housekeeping had attempted to clean it up. And it was still soaking wet at 11:30 p.m.? The solution...reduce the rate from $89 to $67. They forgot to mention the $67 still didn't include taxes/fees. We ended up paying $76 for nasty carpet in a hotel which is in a sketchy area of town (no other restaurants or hotels around). I would recommend every other hotel we stayed in along the Pacific Coast, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very helpful and accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria1025
Reviews.Content: For starters, my friend and I were checking in at different times and had a special request for how to handle the charges between us and they agreed to accommodate us. Then we needed help finding our way around town and they were very specific in their directions which gave us a lot of confidence in an unfamiliar area. And I've never seen THIS before... but they have a library of really cool movies that you can borrow to watch in your room on a DVD player at no charge! A computer to check emails...again no charge. And then breakfast is included from 6-10am also at no charge! Breakfast can easily cost an additional $10-$20 when you're traveling and it was GOOD breakfast. All around, we were really pleased with the room and the staff and all the goodies that were included with the price of a one-night stay. Thanks Old Town Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough.”
Reviews.Author: busterfreak
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. It's in a slightly seedy, industrial area right between Point Loma, Hillcrest and Old Town. I'd just spent a week at a very nice Marriott property right on the bay, so I had my doubts. And when I pulled in to the place, those doubts multiplied. But don't let the gritty neighborhood fool you. Old Town Inn is clean, quiet and safe. The rooms are comfy. And the staff are courteous almost to a fault, bending over backward to make your stay pleasant. In fact at every turn, this odd little find surprised and delighted me. The budget-friendly price is an obvious draw for those sadly lacking trust funds (like me). And the free DVD rentals, quirky as that perk sounds, was a charming touch -- someone here has seriously good taste in movies. Princess Mononoke? At a place called Old Town Inn? In this neighborhood? I'm impressed. Baffled, but impressed. Bottom line, if you're looking for an above-average hotel right off major highways (and close to Sea World) that tries hard to exceed your expectations, this is your Inn. I'd give Old Town Inn five stars, but the neighborhood combined with sloooooow, Skype-unfriendly wi-fi made me stop short. Hey, no place is perfect, but this one is pretty close.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: SweetCountryWoman
Reviews.Content: We can only confirm all the positive reviews. Good location, comfortable rooms, very friendly and helpful staff. Free parking and wifi, plus complimentary breakfast (standard, but well stocked) and coffee & water in the lobby. We stayed in a queen room and appreciated having a microwave and fridge. We’ll be back on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great stay, will plan to upgrade to larger room”
Reviews.Author: rowanmf
Reviews.Content: With AAA membership we got about $10 off the economy room so total after tax was about $96 for a Saturday night. I noticed it was about 15 minutes before check in time of 3pm but the woman at the front desk didn't mention it and was very friendly and delightful when she checked my girlfriend and I in. We stayed in the economy room with the queen size bed. It's a very tiny room with enough space for a small table and couple chairs, two night stands and a tv stand. Large closet though with ironing board and iron and a small coffee maker on the vanity. The bathroom was so tiny that there was only room for a standing shower. We did go into the pool, it was small and heated, better than most motel pools I've seen. The breakfast was great, I love waffles and I got to make my own. There was also juice and milk, cereal, donuts, coffee, bagels and cream cheese and danishes and fruit salad. For being a free breakfast I was pleasantly surprised at how much was offered. I also liked that we didn't have to pay for parking. This, the price of the hotel and the free breakfast and being near Old Town is what sold me. Granted the area isn't the best since it seems to be right in the middle of an industrial area but I didn't have any problems with seeing homeless people or street walkers loitering around the area like some of the other reviewers said. But what really made this stay even better was the kind and friendly service people. My fiance forgot her engagement ring on the bed and realized it AFTER we checked out and AFTER we'd already started our Old Town walking adventure. The woman at the front desk didn't give us a hassle when we asked to go back into the room because we forgot "something" and as my fiance was running full speed back to the room we just past the housekeeping lady that had actually found the ring and was giving it to the woman at the front. Thank you Old Town Inn for a great stay. If we're ever in town again we will probably upgrade to a suite :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Corinealious
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over 4th of July weekend. We got a great rate, free parking, and the pet fee was reasonable. The staff were all so friendly, and very welcoming of our dog. The location is great. Everywhere we went was only a 5-10 minute drive. Its also a short walk to food places and stores. The breakfast was good; Standard continental setup. It was always well stocked, and they kept water and coffee out all day. Room was really nice as well. Can't really say anything bad about our stay! Good value for your stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, second time here and ready for a third”
Reviews.Author: JLoumber
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night (4th of July weekend). This is our second time here. Last year we came and we stayed in one of the deluxe rooms, we had a very good stay so we decided to come back this year. We stayed this time at the economy rooms. Everything was very nice, great front desk service. We arrived around 9PM after a long day at the San Diego Zoo (BTW great experience there :) ) We had a small issue with the bathtub but in less than 5 minutes the front desk lady came and fixed it and apologized profusely about any inconvenience that this may have caused us. We had a great stay and we will definitely come back again (Hopefully in a couple of months!). Ohh, BTW, we are vegan and they offer fruit, oatmeal and juice for breakfast which is great. If you are not, don't worry the also offer different kind of pastries and waffles and boiled eggs and coffee...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and right across the road from the transit station”
Reviews.Author: thirdsunrise
Reviews.Content: Another one with a fancier website than physical site, but comfortable, clean, good breakfast, lovely landscaping and conveniently located just minutes from the airport and a short walk to the Old Town Transit Station with buses and trolleys to wherever you need to go. The Old Town Inn staff is great -- very helpful, and you can get directions, recommendations and discounted tickets to lots of attractions right at the desk. They also have a DVD lending library and coffee and iced water with lemon available in the lobby at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: joseph_sinopoli
Reviews.Content: The girls working the front desk are tops! Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Great breakfast buffet. Anna and Rebecka are very knowledgeable about everthing San Diego. Great pool and BBQ

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: SharonLDRN
Reviews.Content: Since we had to wait until the week before we were sure we would be traveling to make a reservation, I was having a terrible time finding a good place to stay. As I checked every where we had stayed previously, I found they were either sold out or their rates had ridiculously increased. When searching web sites, I kept seeing reviews of the Old Town Inn. When I checked the prices, I was skeptical about the lower prices that went along with the great reviews. I also couldn't get a good feeling for what the area was like. But I was getting desperate and "went for it" When I called for the reservation, the person I spoke with (sorry I am terrible wth names) was one of the most positive customer service people I have ever spoken with. She treated me like I was the most important person she was taking care of. She was informative, knowledgeable, gracious and personable. I had to call the night before and ask if the room would hold one more adult, who decided to come with us at the last minute. The person I spoke to then said there was a fold out couch that could be slept on, but also stated it might not be as comfortable as a bed. There would be a minimal added charge for the third person. I had a comfortable feeling about this place after speaking to these people on the phone. Upon arrival, (easy to find), the desk person was happy to see us and once again very personable. She explained everything thoroughly, informed us of times for breakfast and sincerely seemed to care about our stay. Once we got to our room, it was just more reinforcement that we had made the correct choice in staying there. We had a large room with a two burner stove, sink, fridge and microwave and lots of kitchen type cupboards. The couch was comfortable for sleeping.They also delivered a plastic tub of kitchen utensils, pots, pans and dishes for us to use. The bathroom vanity/sink was separate from the shower and toilet. Nice nightstands, chest of drawers and desk No problems receiving internet. Beautiful landscapes, everything well kept up and no bad smells anywhere. Breakfast had many items, though I would have liked some additional protein choices (yogurt). Lots of carbs. Juice ws NOT watered down. Attendant kept all items well stocked, no matter the time. There were movies and board games you could check out, always coffee, tea in he office lounge. Washer and dryer. The heated pool was nicely landscaped with many chairs. Would have liked a hot tub. The desk people always had the correct answers for any questions and always were personable and smiling. We will definitely refer this place and use it for additional stays. I would recommend it for anyone!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: webbje
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific experience at this hotel. The front desk staff were extremely helpful in answering our questions about the area. The room was terrific, had everything we needed and was a very reasonable price. We were able to purchase attraction tickets through the hotel for a discounted price...which was great. The breakfast choices were terrific...especially when traveling with 2 picky children. I would stay here again...and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “They try really hard but they can't make up for the poorly constructed hotel in a less-than-ideal neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: katnap01
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Super friendly staff 2. Clean rooms 3. Free basic wifi in some rooms 4. Free parking 5. Free breakfast 6. Free upgrade given to make us happier 7. Free HBO 8. Great Inn-siders guide to the neighbourhood 9. Great pool 10. Great DVD library Cons: 1. Super noisy rooms. You can hear aeroplanes every 3 minutes. The neighbour's plumbing sounds like a torrential downpour. You can hear the woman in high heels walking back and forth to get ice from the machine. You can hear the train whistles. You can hear the freeways and the traffic on pacific highway. You can hear the trash truck at 4:30 in the morning. You can hear the neighbour's TV and conversations. You get the idea... 2. WiFi never worked in either of the rooms. We even spent an hour on the phone with tech support. The wifi signal just isn't strong enough. 3. The wifi is limited to 3mb for the entire hotel. That means no netflix, no YouTube, no updating apps, no downloading, etc. Only basic web browsing and small emails. 4. Dodgy neighbourhood. We had a man linger about outside our room, peer through the windows, and even knock on our door to ask to speak to a fake person. We called front desk and they escorted him from the property. Also, you're only seconds from psych facilities and there are numerous homeless around because of the proximity of health and human services, the central transport depot, etc. 5. They never did fix the wifi despite three conversations. We probably won't return. It's just too noisy. And we really like having a hotel with unrestricted and working wifi during a long stay. However, we really did appreciate the room upgrade and some of the efforts made to make us happier. Without those efforts, we would have left after the first night. Thanks for trying.

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingcutie
Reviews.Content: My husband and kids (ages 4 and 2) booked a stay at Old Town Inn, based on the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. And we're glad we did! As other reviews have mentioned, the location is a little strange, not near other hotels or residential areas either. But it is within minutes of the airport, and is right across the street from the transit center, so there's easy access to buses, trolleys and trains. We did not have a rental car, so were reliant on public transport, but if you have a car, there is free parking. When we checked in (at 10 AM!) the front desk people gave us lots of information on the area, including a guide to getting around by public transport, with tips on how to get to local attractions, grocery store, beaches and more. Very helpful! The closest grocery store is just a couple of bus stops away. There are also tons of other stores (Target and such) as well as a lot of fast food in that area. Super close if you have a car and very accessible by bus as well. We spent our first two nights in the one bedroom suite. There was so much space in this suite- we loved it! Everything was clean and well-stocked. Wi-fi didn't work in this room, but the front desk gave us a cord to use the high speed with our laptop. We also enjoyed the ability to check out DVDs- a great end to our busy days in San Diego. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious- heavy on the carbs, but still good. Coffee, tea, and water are available all day in the lobby as well. If you need to do laundry, there are a couple of coin-operated machines near the lobby. We especially appreciated this, when traveling with little kids. The hotel was quiet and we slept well all of the nights that we were there. For our last night, we switched to a basic room, since we'd booked late and the suite wasn't free for our whole trip. The basic room was also very clean and comfortable. The front desk was very helpful with our switching process, making sure we got a new room close to our old one, to make moving our belongings as easy as possible. This isn't the fanciest hotel that I've ever stayed in, but it's clean and comfortable and affordable and the customer service is outstanding, and the location is convenient for all sorts of places in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great, nice atmosphere, verry nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette83
Reviews.Content: So nice, great breakfast area, sweet swimming pool, near the old town. You can borrow dvd's which is nice, you can get tea or coffe from the common area to your room. You can BBQ at the pool in the evening. Clean rooms, good shower. Would absolutely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: bigfuzzybear
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel in a central location, albeit just off the highway. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. there is also a business center with free printing. There is a nice movie collection if you want to stay in for the night or have kids. breakfast is great - lots of choice, and constantly monitored/replenished by the staff. We had to leave really early when we checked out and the staff made sure to open the dining room for us to have a quick bite. on the other hand, our room was in the older building and farther from the main building, so wifi didnt work. if you go, try to get a room in the main building - apparently it is newly renovated. towels were thin and rough, and we went to the front desk for an extra towel each day, which got annoying. however, we still recommend old town inn - it is a great place for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: elo-jmm
Reviews.Content: I love this small hotel! Everyone is super friendly and helpful from the time you set foot on the property. My husband and I arrived after a long day and upon check-in our FD agent welcomed us back and made us feel right at home. She offered us free movies to watch in our room, Free Wi-Fi, coffee & tea, made sure we knew about breakfast the next morning and because we were here to cheer our family @ the SD Marathon when asked she was able to give us a late check out. Truly a magnificent stay. We stayed in the old bldg and the rooms although small are comfortable, neat and immaculately cleaned. We have and will continue to recommend this hotel to everyone that visits San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: kelly2137
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Old Town inn is fantastic! Very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast provided in the morning is perfect to get your day going without having to go out as soon as you wake up. The pool looked great, although it ended up being to cold to use while we were there. Thye lobby was very inviting especially when they lit a wood burning fire in the fireplace (too bad we were checking out)! Walking distance to Old Town is great! We did check out one of their free DVDs, but the DVD player died on us and we were not able to watch it. I'm sure they would've come to fix it or change it out, but we just found something else to watch, The computer set up in the lobby with free priniting is a big plus too. The rooms were perfectly clean which is the main thing really. Our only complaint is the way they make the bed with all kinds of sheets every which way. IT loks great for presentation, but not the best for sleeping...too tangled! All in all a great hotel, much less expensive than being on the beach and better in every way than hotel circle. I ahve already recommended to others and we will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Central though frightening location.”
Reviews.Author: Btj1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family suite strangely with my family on a San Diego zoo excursion. It was wonderful to have so much space refrigerator and amenities top notch two televisions each with DVD player made for easier night, recommends pizza place was fast and passable. Overall great stay. One negative is also a positive central location is central to all sorts of other stuff. Ran over to wal-grens for a forgoten prescription and realized this was a bad neighborhood. Two blocks from adult stores and the airport. Hotel wonderful nearby a bit scary. Good staff and safe feeling oasis-like grounds made it a recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: MaineBlueberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we were in town for a Padres game. The hotel is right across from a trolley stop that goes directly to and from PETCO Park and downtown, and at $5 for a day pass, much better than parking downtown. We stayed in the economy rooms: nothing too special, but clean, quiet, and a great rate. The staff were friendly and helpful on tourist information, and the breakfast was good (especially liked the fruit).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly staff, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: vkramaro
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly, and helped us with the tickets for various attractions. The breakfast, on the other hand, was not as good as I hoped. I like having meat for breakfast, and there were no meat dishes at all. My biggest complaint would the noise that you hear from trains, planes and automobiles; also if your room is on the ground floor, every time the neighbors upstairs would take a shower, it would sound as if there is an actual waterfall next room (it became very irritating when they were taking showers too late at night or too early in the morning).

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect for us in every aspect.”
Reviews.Author: 154945David
Reviews.Content: The front dest staff were extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful to enable us to get around to see the things we wanted to see. They also made some of the arrangements for us. The complimentary breakfast was very good and there was plenty of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this value”
Reviews.Author: revtom
Reviews.Content: For a great value on a nice place to stay, I don't think you can beat the Old Town Inn. Walking distance from all of the Old Town attractions (and some outstanding restaurants), and less than a five minute walk to the transportation center for buses and tolleys, the location was amazing. Add to that the friendliness and efficiency of the staff, a very nice continental breakfast and the cleanliness of the rooms, this is just a wonderful motel. It's not the newest or fanciest, but I'm sure it must be the best value out there. (And, for what it's worth, "value" isn't the first thing we usually look for, so this was a big plus!)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great access to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: terina333
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably a 10minute taxi ride from downtown, it is in an industrial area but the hotel looks so pretty and welcoming, with lovely flowers surrounding the site. Location is good as it was a short walk to Old Town and we got the train to downtown which didn't take very long at all. Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming, our room was fine, it actually had a fridge and microwave in as well, but we didn't use these as we went out to eat. The reception area to the hotel has a lounge area with board games and films to borrow. Also free wireless internet and a computer to use in reception. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “deserves all good reviews”
Reviews.Author: demonsAlbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in April this year.5 minute taxi ride from train station,Easy check in , nice and informal and personal.Fron desk staff very helpful and maintained enthusiasm throughout. Room was a little dark for our liking , but good size, very clean and well fitted out.Nice and quit too, providing windows closed. 10 minute walk to Old Town, full of reastaurants and 5 minute walk to Trolley car into downtown San Diago.Great value fo rmoney at around $100 aussie per night.bw,d

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: callifuntrvl08
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice property with many flowers growing all around. Nice lobby with computer available for guests. Great breakfast consisting of waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, pastries, muffins, bagels,. fresh fruit as well as a tropical canned fruit mix, a variety of cereals, juice, milk and coffee, hot chocolate.....Easy walk to Old Town and Restaurants. Movies available to check out. Easy freeway access. Good customer service! Hope to stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “These Ladies Could Teach hotel management!!”
Reviews.Author: marialulu
Reviews.Content: We would like to find a place like the Old Town Inn whenever or wherever we travel. they do everything right from the phone reservation, to check in, to helping you get oriented to the city, graciously giving directions and tips, calling taxis, storing luggage, whatever!! The place is good value, our room was spacious and clean, well appointed, no skimping on anything, everything worked, even the clock!! (How often do you have to reset the clock because someone has unplugged it? Kind of an aggravation when you arrive tired and just want to settle in and not figure out how to reset a clock!). The lobby is cozy and welcoming, the breakfast room is bright and well tended, food items restocked as needed, again no skimping on anything. We didn't have time to use the pool area but it is very attractive and well tended also. They even have a free laundry room for guests to use. I can't say enough positive things about this place and the sweet ladies who run it. It's on my radar for any future San Diego visits even if the location is not the most convenient if you are without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: xmansmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn from April 7-April 12th. Anna was AWESOME. She made sure to make us feel right at home! The rooms (we had to switch to a bottom floor room...cause of our little one)....both of the rooms were so clean and smelled great! The extra pillows they provide in the rooms were so nice...the bathrooms were clean and fresh towels everyday (with a little one we use alot!!!) was perfect!!! Everyday after a long day of sightseeing and traveling around in/out of town...it was just so nice to come back to the room....it was our home away from home...and it was just plain comfortable! The free breakfast was great too...it really helped not having to pay for breakfast 5 days! The food was fresh (like the waffles) and the fruit was delicious! The landscaping was BEAUTIFUL! My husband and son loved the pool(heated)...it was fun for them to get in and play around while I did laundry...and it was pet friendly...I wish we would have brought our dog! Just a FRIENDLY fun little hotel. Loved it...Overall...I would absolutely stay at the Old Town Inn again...the staff was polite, friendly and ALWAYS helpful! And the price was excellent...we shopped around long and hard before we decided were to stay and we made the best choice with Old Town Inn! We really enjoyed ourselves and hope to make it back to San Diego one day! (P.S. Buy the Zoo and Trolley tickets there at the hotel...every dollar counts...they were able to save us 8 bucks on Zoo tickets...it was just a GREAT deal!! )

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: KSUgrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a bungalow room - very well updated, very comfortable, very good price. Old Town is easy walking distance and has all kinds of things to see and places to eat. Being close to the Old Town Transportation Center allowed us to use the trolley to get to downtown, Little Italy and Mission Diego de Alcala. Desk staff is very helpful in giving information and directions. Driving to Balboa Park and all its museums from here was very easy! Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Families!”
Reviews.Author: kids_on_the_road_11
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in a Family Suite from April 6th-9th. The Family Suite was large and allowed us to cook some meals in our room. The kitchen includes a small refridgerator, two burner stove and microwave. There is a dining table that seats three. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. There was a good deal of construction noise due to sewer repair work directly behind our room, and the hotel staff discounted our room as a result. There is free wifi, but the connection speed is very slow and I received a much faster connection using my the Verizon network on my 3G smartphone. We took advantage of the free DVDs in the lobby and the continental breakfast daily. We enjoyed the location close to Old Town and Seaworld. We will definitely consider staying here in the future when visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: rayandgabby
Reviews.Content: my fiance, 4 y.o. Daughter, and I stayed here on a completely unplanned roadtrip down to SD. We had just gone on a trip a few weeks prior so we werent looking to spend a lot of $. Anyway, gave this place a call and booked a room for ninety bucks which was a king bed and a rollout for my daughter... The room was nothing fancy, pretty basic, but they do have some ammenities which make it standout. They let u check out dvds as well as games from the lobby. This was great for my daughter who I played a game of jenga with and watched shrek before bed... Also the location is within walking distance to old town, which is one of our favorite attractions in SD. also the breakfast was pretty decent. Bagels, waffles, hard boiled eggs, toast, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, coffee, juice... Other than that I did notice the pool which we did not have time to jump in..plus I noticed they have an arcade game down by the lobby which was pretty interesting. The front desk lady was also very polite so no issue there. Now the only problem was that the motel was apparently renovating the rooms to be non smoking, but ours did smell pretty strongly of cigarette smoke. that was the only minor complaint and will hopefully be fixed in the near future. Overall, I would definitely recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, very friendly/helpful, clean”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler2222
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff. Anytime we had questions or needed something they were always willing to help. They new the area and the best places to go. Rooms were clean and nice. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to San Diego, especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - thoroughly enjoyed the stay - Def Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Ch_Pat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and i was definitely not disappointed. Before anything or everything else, i wanted to commend the staff on the extremely friendly and extremely cheerful attitude. That in itself makes a sea of change to the experience. They are very cheerful, always on the helping mode and you would feel as though you are speaking to your friends. Add to this, a very clean hotel room, a very well maintained and clean surroundings, a nice small pool; and with free breakfast, you have a place that is definitely worth staying again and again. The rooms are comfortable, very clean and very well maintained. The surroundings and the pool is alos very well kept and maintained very well. Though close to the tram and trolley stop, the hotel is very calm and quiet. There are just two floors of rooms, and there are only stairs to get into the rooms - so you might need to carry up the luggage if u r carrying heavy ones :). The location, the cleanliness, the standards maintained and on top of all , the people, make this hotel a really highly recommended one in my list.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: thawsout
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in fall & summer while my daughter attends SDSU; now I'm staying in spring for her graduation and I will happily return during her grad. school time. I love the quiet, clean, very comfortable rooms, garden, good breakfast, tea, coffee, cocoa & cold water available, cozy lobby area with library & internet computer to use there; even movies to loan. U am very grateful that they have free ice :-) & I also appreciate it's location near Old Town & trolley & a short drive to all else. Perhaps the best is the staff, most friendly & helpful of anywhere I've stayed & they will go out of their way to help (right Mary?). I highly recommend it for singles (I felt completely safe on my week's stay on my own or with my daughter, as well as the couple's get away, families and couples and have enjoyed these experiences equally. Thank you again for making me feel at home. SDSU Mom

Reviews.Title: “This is the place your looking for....”
Reviews.Author: razorback98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling with our children on a Saturday night looking for a room. We had been traveling for 12 hours and couldn't decide in a room in Laguna or Newport beach because we wanted the kids to get to swim. We decided to give up finding a place to swim after a long day due to location and prices. We were shooting for under a hundred on our non Disney days to help with budget. We decided just to head down to San Diego since we were going to seaworld and the zoo. I called Old town inn after 8 and found the place we needed. Got a good deal we were coming in late . We made it in time to swim also. The room was very clean and spacious. It was very clean as was the lobby. They have free DVDs to watch in room. They also have a bunch of board games. So , if you have children pretty good setup. Breakfast was pretty good. Three different cereals, various pastries/muffins, boiled eggs, fruit,coffee, orange juice, and make your own waffles. Location was great for the zoo, seaworld, and Old Town. It is across from a storage/warehouse but still great location. They have discounted tickets for Seaworld and SDZoo. It's $4 off a ticket. Went to stay one day and within 30 minutes of arriving , I booked for Sunday night also. We would not stay anywhere else when we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, it was perfect. I loved my stay here.”
Reviews.Author: lmcgregor
Reviews.Content: I went to San Diego to celebrate an event in my life and unfortunately had to go alone as something came up for my traveling companion. I chose the Old Town Inn because of the Trip Advisor review and because it was very close to the trolleys at Old Town. I expected that would be very helpful to go everywhere I wanted to go without having to take a taxi. I was so right! Five minute walk to the trolley and the Coaster and everwhere was within my reach. The staff was really helpful and very friendly. There is a wonderful continental breakfast each morning and the pool is beautiful. Coffee, tea, and lemon water was available in the front lobby all day. No hot tub but that was the ONLY thing that was missing. Rooms were clean and bright. I would definitely recommend the Old Town Inn to anyone who wants a good vacation, great service and does not want to spend a fortune on accomodations. Thanks to all the staff for making my stay very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice place....the only complain is the wi-fi service...”
Reviews.Author: noroeste62
Reviews.Content: The place is in a great location and very close to Old Town. We didn't find it noisy and the rooms were very clean. The staff is very helpful and very attentive I can't say anything bad about them. The room where we stayed had some problemswith the electric inlets and when we reported them the electician came over almost right away and fixed them. Breakfast is excellent for the price and the dinning room is very clean and comfortable. Oour only complain was the wi-fi service. It kept disconnecting us each time it happened we had to call their internet provider who told us that the motel internet connection runs on a very low speed and they don't recommend to watch any videos or big photos on your laptop,which we didnt' do and yet kept losing the internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TeresaSammis
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay in this locally owned hotel and enjoyed our stay. It was a short walk to Old Town and the trolley, which is one of the reasons we chose this venue. The breakfast was the typical continental fare, but better stocked and fresher than many I've seen. The pool ares was nicely landscaped and clean. The lobby was very nice with a fire in the fireplace which was cozy. (And needed. It got cold while we were there.) We stayed in one of the older rooms, which was immaculate. The weather had turned in San Diego and we got in late, and were cold that first night, so asked for extra blankets which they cheerfully provided. Probably the only downside, which was specific to our room, was we were right on the street with a wall of windows so got a lot of traffic noise. I think one room in from us was a lot quieter. So we'd stay there again, but probably ask for a different room. The staff was exceptional and helpful to us. Overall, a great bargain, immaculate and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: RMillerLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews we decided to book this hotel for its value and there was no disappointment. With a AAA discount we stayed a Sat nite for $ 100 in a room that was very clean and had all the amenities we needed. The beds were very tidy and comfortable, and although the room wasn't large it didn't feel cramped, and was laid out very efficiently. Particularly useful was that there sinks in different areas so that both of us could get ready at the same time without interfering with each other. Noise levels were quite good too. Staff at the front desk and in the breakfast room were very friendly and helpful. They gave us good guidance on attractions, and sold us Zoo tickets for a slight discount ($ 4 off regular price). That saved standing in line to get tickets at the Zoo. Of course, considering the price there are some compromises to make when staying at Old Town Inn. One is that there is no restaurant or bar on site. Another is that there are no tourist attractions, restaurants, bars, groceries/drugstores in walking distance. You can't get into Old Town itself (despite the name) because you have to cross a 4 lane highway.. However, the location is very central for reaching San Diego's main attractions by car (Zoo, Midway, Botanical Gardens, Old Town, Coronado, Petco Park, Gaslight area, LaJolla etc). All within 15-20 minutes drive. The only other downside is the lack of an exercise facility although they do have a nice swimming pool. They don't have a separate "Business Center" room but they do have a computer and printer in an area near the front desk so that you can run off boarding passes and/or maps. Given all that, Old Town Inn would not be an ideal place for an extended stay because of its lack of certain amenities and the inability to easily walk out and get them nearby (like a restaurant or bar).. On the other hand, for a quick 1-2 night stay where you don't plan to spend much time at the hotel and only want clean, efficient, pleasantly decorated rooms , helpful service, and a convenient location for driving to points in San Diego at a very reasonable price, this place can't be beat....

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a better value”
Reviews.Author: belwah1
Reviews.Content: This is our third year of staying here. The last two years we've stayed there for two weeks. Pretty hard to find any faults with this operation. Their people are top notch, they care and if you have a problem or a request it's taken care of. Maintenance and cleanliness seem to be a priority. The location near the junction of Interstates 5 & 8 makes it easy to get to all the major tourist attractions. Their breakfast room is one of the nicer that we've been in. Their lobby with fireplace is nice place to sit and enjoy. Finally, their price strucure is very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest”
Reviews.Author: braino1966
Reviews.Content: visiting san deigo for the first time and 3 days to get it all in. we were 10 mins. from the harbor,15 from (ob)the beach, 10 from sea world, 20 from balboa park (once you get the washing ton st. exit off pch. lol), a short walk to old town for some fantastic dining the staff was brilliant in helping us. thanks cecillia and anna it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No absolutely cheap, but a very good deal”
Reviews.Author: Fraianeli
Reviews.Content: I stayed one weekend in this hotel and enjoyed it very much. The lady that was at the balcon started talking to me like I was stupid, I don't know if it's because she realized that I was not American, or because she usually speaks like. Depsite this fact, she gave me a few hints on how to go to some landmarks (they give one paper with instructions on how to use public transportation to go to landmarks) and a few facts about the hotel. Speaking of going to places, the location of the hotel is great, because it is in a 5 minute walking distance to one of the blue line stations. The only very small flaw, is that there are not many signs telling where is the hotel, so if you're on your first time, you might turn in the wrong direction. The rooms were clean. I wouldn't say the bathroom was impecably clean, but it was in good conditions. The rest of the hotel seemed very clean too. The rooms were good and the beds confortable. The TV didn't have a good quality of image, so the hotel lost points there. And finally, the price was fair considering local prices and hotel qualities, but still not very low if you're on a budget.In this case, maybe you can forget some of its advantages and look for a cheaper hotel

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozziebren
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Old Town Inn because of Trip advisor.I was told the Bus and Trolley service was just across the road. I didn't have a car, so it was great for me to get around San Diego.For $5 a day I went everywhere.From the Beach to the Zoo,even to the Border of Mexico. The hotel was very clean, the room comfortable, and the coffee machine in the room was great for my early morning coffee.My room over looking the pool.The breakfast was very good and set me up for the day of sight seeing.The staff were very helpful.They had lemon water,tea and coffee all day in the lounge for guest.There was also a computer for guest to use.I will be staying here again if I ever go to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, effiecient staff and clean and cozy facilities”
Reviews.Author: WildflowerWatcher
Reviews.Content: We selected the Old Town Inn based on reviews on TripAdvisor and weren't disappointed. We booked the 'Managers Special' - stay 5 nights get two free, which really made the Inn a bargain rate. We stayed in an 'economy' room, which was smallish but perfectly adequate and very clean. The breakfast was better than I've had at pricier places and the woman who staffed the breakfast room on Sunday, Feb. 20 was amazing. The place was packed and she efficiently, effectively, and pleasantly replenished everything constantly. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The Inn is also conveniently located. Getting anywhere was easy and they have a sheet of excellent directions to get you places. We also bought our discounted zoo tickets there too. I'd stay there again. You do hear traffic but you're in a city.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BJPToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time staying at the Old Town Inn. We had a King room with fridge and microwave, so we were able to pack lunches and do dinners in. The room is fairly spacious, with an enormous bathoom area (2 separate areas, each with sinks and counters). So handy to be able to spread our stuff out!! The beds were very comfortable. The only thing we did not like is that the fitted sheets were too small for the bed and kept popping off in the night!! The breakfast at Old Town Inn is terrific(cereal, make your own waffles, hard boiled eggs, fruit salad, danishes, bagels, toast,etc). I like the library of books and dvds that they have in the lobby. The staff at Old Town are always helpful and friendly. The location is the thing that keeps bringing us back to Old Town. It is so easy to get around without a car. You can get a cheap transit pass from the trolley/bus station across the road and go everywhere for next to nothing. From the airport the hotel is a 15 dollar cab ride. The hotel has free internet, but you do need to be careful to only use it for email. If you try to view anything on you tube, or download anything, you will be permanently cut off the internet. So you have to be careful. This is the only place we would ever stay when we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Stayed her overnight before cruise out of San Diego. Comfortable rooms. Service good. Breakfast good. Parking good. Free internet access. We like the shopping nearby. Car is required to enjoy fully. Short cab ride to airport. Public Transit downtown starts over the street in Old Town itself. Good choice and value for our purpose. This was our 3rd stay here.

Reviews.Title: “comforts of home away from home”
Reviews.Author: joe geography
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay @ Old Town Inn. The staff are cordial and eager to make guests as comfortable as possible. The facility, though not new, has been very well maintained and updated as needed. The rooms in the cottages are small but have everything we needed. Our room was always spotless when we returned each day. The grounds are beautifully planted and well tended. The water in the swim pool was sparkling clear and inviting. The continental breakfast each morning was a bonus. We have recommended the Old Town Inn to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot, close to transportation”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryWill
Reviews.Content: We stayed there a few nights before taking a cruise from San Diego. The place is really convenient to highways and commuter trains, so you can get around easily. We had a queen room with mini-fridge and microwave so we could handle a few meals on our own. The room was large as well. Excellent breakfast included as well. Includes fruit, Danish, muffins, bagels, cold boiled eggs, plus usual stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for group gatherings.”
Reviews.Author: mdgandy9075
Reviews.Content: This is our second year our church (OLPH) held a Facilitators over night retreat. It is so nice to come to a hotel and the accomodations are outstanding. We had use of the large dining area for our meeting place as well as to dine there.. We took advantage of their barbecue and the outdoor garden pool area for meditation. We were greeted by friendly staff and were very helpful. I look forward returing to OLD Town Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kanah56
Reviews.Content: I've come two years in a row with my Church group. The rooms are meticulously clean and comfortable, and the kitchen and lounge are too, with a beautiful pool. Old Town is an easy walk and so is the trolley and bus. Nights are very quiet- easy to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “SCC Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Ralphs
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed upon our arrival by very pleasant helpful Registration personnel.The rooms are spacious; clean the beds are very comfortable. Our group required a meeting place and we had at our disposal a large dining area. Since we were having a BBQ both Saturday afternoon and evening we were given the outside BBQ area with a pool off the main kitchen. Utinsels were made available for our use. The full breakfast consisted of boiled eggs; make your own waffles; toast; and bagels. There were various fruits and sweet rolls available plus coffee and milk for cereals. We felt very welcomed and at home and will no doubt be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, relaxing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritwood
Reviews.Content: A group of parishioners from our church stayed here overnight and enjoyed excellent customer service! We met in the breakfast room, watched a video on the big screen TV, BBQ'd on the new grill in the pool area and then went to our rooms for a great night sleep! We met the next morning in the breakfast room and enjoyed the free breakfast and then met to close our week-end experience in a family suite. This is our second year here for this gathering and we will definitely be back again next year! Don't miss this shining gem in Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel: Clean and spacious with a friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NBSmith
Reviews.Content: They have it all: great pillows, hair-dryer and an iron, good bed, marvelously helpful staff, good breakfast for not much money, ample free parking. Only drawback is the road and airplane noise, so keep the windows shut.

Reviews.Title: “Died and Went to Heaven”
Reviews.Author: jwprice
Reviews.Content: Last week I felt I was in Heaven. I was in San Diego at the Old Town Inn. Sunny, cloudless skies, 70 degrees, palm trees, and a nice quiet pool. While my first time there was great. the hotel I feel is not for the corporate crowd needing a 4G WiFi network. The premises are very well kept up. Staff is very helpful (Rebecca at the front desk answered all my dumb questions with charm and patience.) There is a varied (standard) breakfast, which allows you to pick whatever you like. I stayed in one of the economy bungalow units; next time I'll go for the newer wing. BTW - if you want a big breakfast, go to Perry's Cafe 2 blocks north. I would go elsewhere for lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: pickyjimmy
Reviews.Content: this is the first time using trip advisor to pick a hotel. I was glad I did. This hotel is convienently located just 7 minutes from Sea World. We were able to buy our tickets from the hotel and they were cheaper than buying them at the park. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is included, which is great because you save $20 right there. They also have DVD players in all the rooms with DVD's you can borrow from the hotel. The staff is very attentive and friendly. I was going to stay only 1 night, just in case, but ended up staying for all 3 nights I was in town.

Reviews.Title: “the best customer service at any hotel i have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bonnie999
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the old town inn in october. they were the nicest and most accomodating staff i have ever encountered. they were helpful from drugstore items i forgot, to letting my husband watch the football game after checkout before our cab took us to the airport. it was so convienent to the transportation that when we go back ( and we will!!!) we would definately stay there again and not bother with a car again. everything worked out better than i could have imagined.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tgdayoh
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is convenietly located to the trolley and bus lines. It is easy to get to nearly all of the best San Diego attractions from this location. The hotel is attractive and well maintained. The prices were the most reasonable that I found. The staff was friendly and courteous. I will stay here if I am ever in San Diego in the future and will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: katieb4m
Reviews.Content: We came down for our sons graduation from the Marines. We had 2 rooms and stayed 3 nights. The rooms are very clean and the bed are very comfortable. Could of used another blanket and I'm sure they had them but I didn't not ask. The rooms are very clean. The hotel staff is very friendly. The breakfast was good. When you first get there the neighborhood looks a little iffy BUT we felt safe and it's really close to MCRD and other stores. We are so glad we stayed here. I will recommend this to my friends who's son's are at MCRD right now. Thank you Old Town Inn for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoke blowing in through bathroom vent”
Reviews.Author: fivehappytravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friend and asked for non smoking room. We were put in a dark room, under stairwell that had no view of anything except stairs. room was fairly clean but I think the staff smoking area must have been behind our room because cigarette smoke came in through our bathroom vent all night! We turned the fan on, but it didn't help much. * breakfast was great, but big line up. Fresh fruit salad was a bonus. * pool was clean(didn't swim though) * staff were nice *the area the hotel is situated in is quite seedy Overall, my friends and I agreed that we would stay here again if we had a room on the second floor and away from smoking areas.

Reviews.Title: “More Than we Expected”
Reviews.Author: vestor42
Reviews.Content: Long ago Holiday Inn advertised "The Best Surprise is no Surprise" This Inn disproved the slogan. The surprise was for the best. I had good recomendations but they were short of what we got. It was perfect in every way. Truly a joy to stay at and I will definately stay there every time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: janeeyre316
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after a large neuroscience conference, and I actually preferred this hotel to the four-star hotel I was in for the first five nights of the conference. The rooms are clean and comfortable, although a little old. The staff was excellent, friendly, and radiated competence. The perks are what really set this place apart. The lobby has an excellent DVD selection that can be borrowed for free, as well as books and board games. The free Wifi, free breakfast, and ever-present coffee in the lobby were very welcome. It's a five minute walk to the nearest train stop and to Old Town, which is kitschy but fun. This is a great option for someone wanting a comfortable, cheap base to explore the rest of San Diego, and I'll be staying here the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, accessible location, iffy neighborhood …”
Reviews.Author: J13345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Old Town Inn for 2 nights while attending a work-related conference at the San Diego Convention Center (SDCC). I stayed at less than half the rate of a hotel within walking distance to the SDCC and even with the SDCC parking ($10). The OTI is slightly less than 10 minute drive on surface streets to the CC and about 2 blocks to Old Town San Diego. The neighborhood looks iffy mostly because it appears to be largely industrial rather than commercial or residential … also the trash, the liquor stores, and the wandering homeless. Personally, I wouldn’t stay here without a vehicle because there isn’t anything besides Old Town I would want to walk to. The property however stand out all the more because of the environs – it is well kept and well lit. Plenty of parking right in front of the rooms. Access to San Diego is good since it is located right on Pacific Highway which leads straight to the harbor and downtown. The other way is the Sports Arena area where there are quite a few restaurants, shops, lumber store, etc and of course the Sports Arena. It is a little awkward getting to the motel from Pacific Highway since it is a south bound one way so if you are coming north up Pacific you probably want to turn left at Kurtz then right on Rosecrans and right again on Pacific. The airport is really close but not so close so as you are bothered by the sounds of aircraft. The motel is at the junction of the 5 and the 8 Freeways. If you’re interested take a look at the management response of September 20, 2010 – gives a little bit of history and context if its authentic. My experience was overall favorable. No problems with my reservations or with check-in. You get a nice hospitality pack with your check-in materials and the staff was friendly and efficient. My room (a non-smoking queen) was tidy and did not smell of cigarettes. The TV had fewer cable channels than some other hotels with similar price range but they have a library of DVDs in the lobby you can watch for free on the DVD player in your room. My room had a small refrigerator and microwave. Also a coffee maker with coffee packets, hair dryer, iron, and ironing board. I noticed that each day one towel, the first tissue paper, and toilet paper ends were folded in some kind of origami decoration – a nice touch especially considering it must have taken somebody some extra time to fold and plait the stuff. My bed was kinda soft but not a problem. Both nights the locale had no other noises than the occasional train in the distance and a little bit of freeway rumble. The breakfast area was clean and bright. The complimentary breakfast includes waffles you make yourself, a variety of pastries, bagels, toast, boiled eggs, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, coffee and tea. Not exactly hearty fare but, you know, it’s healthier that way. I noted that on the morning I checked out that the bagels were hard enough to knock out fillings (i.e. stale) – just a warning. Observing my fellow travelers at breakfast, I would guess they were mostly families on trips of some kind rather than business travel but you never know. This is my kind of place meaning functional and value – not the place anybody would run away to in order to “pop the question,” spice their marriage, or maybe ruin their marriage. I’m not exactly certain I would stay here again except if I were attending another work event at the Convention Center and needed to save money and I wouldn’t want to stay here without a vehicle. Overall, my stay was positive and I found the place a great value for being so close and accessible to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay when in SD”
Reviews.Author: BadDadFun
Reviews.Content: We think this is a great find when looking for a place to stay in San Diego. This fit our budget well. We can't say enough nice things about this charming place. The service was great, everyone was very helpful. The prices were great they have three types of rooms, all well within everyone’s budget and well under $100.00 per night. They have a small pool decorated with lots of flowers. Also available the lobby had movies (DVDs) that we were able to check out. They had drinks (coffee, tea and water) available all day long in the lobby. In the morning they had a nice breakfast buffet that included a make your own waffle. The beds were very comfy. A great place for anyone be it a family or a couple, and cheaper than a motel six. Don't let the neighborhood derail you. It was very quiet area of town even with the train and tram next door. A very nice thing about this hotel was it is next to the tram and bus station. For our week stay we used this system to get around and left our car behind, what a nice way to see San Diego. Yes, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tspencer37
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Old Town Inn. Its about 2 blocks from Old Town. Its very easy to walk to Old Town from the hotel. We felt very safe in the area. The free breakfast was beyond our expectations. We recieved a welcome pack when we checked in along with coupons and maps of Old Town and of San Diego. Everyone who worked there was very friendly. We stayed there for 5 nights. Our room was on the second floor. The king bed was fantastic and the room was well maintained. Our son lives in San Diego and we plan on staying there from now on when we visit. Tim Spencer

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we had hoped it would be”
Reviews.Author: tigner4
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip out to San Diego to visit the Zoo, Wild Animal Park and Seaworld. We were looking for somewhere to stay that was reasonable close to all these locations and could accomadate myself, my husband and our 3 children ages 6,4 & 17 months. Old Town Inn was perfect. We stayed in a room with a king bed and sofabed and it worked very well. It was very clean, the pillows were heaven and the king bed fit me, my husband and littlest very nicely. We had a small fridge and microwave in the room and the room also came with a DVD player. You just check out movies from the check-in area for free. They were very understanding about my children getting pizza on the movie covers :) When we checked in, it was quick and easy. Breakfast is served from 6-10 every morning. They offer the typical fruit, cereal, coffee, pastries and self made waffles. We ate there every morning before heading out on our ventures. They are located next to a pretty busy road but I never heard any of the cars at night. You can walk to Old Town from the hotel, but we drove because of the weather. If you are looking for some delicious food, please check out Pizza Bella. You won't be disappointed and they deliver to the hotel too! All in all, we enjoyed our stay and if we are ever in that area again, we will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “this the the place to stay, what a hidden gem !”
Reviews.Author: blueyedgirl1022
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great find when looking to stay in San Diego on a budget. I just got back and I can't say enough nice things aobut this charming hidden gem. The service was great everyone was just so helpful. We were even given a coupon for a free dessert at Freds in old town anda welcome pack on arrival.. The prices were great they have three types of rooms, all well within everyones budget and well under $100.00 per night. A verty pretty charming pool are with lots of flowers and a bbq . Also available the lobby had movies that we were able to check out , coffe, tea and a mint water were available all day. In the morning they had a really nice breakfast buffet that included a waffle making experience that was both fun and yummy. The beds were very comfy and our room even had a small frig and a pullout couch/ bed. A great place for anyone be it a family or a couple, and cheaper than a motel six. Don't let the neighborhood derail you. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: Bea962
Reviews.Content: I was dismayed at first as we didn't have a car but with what we saved staying there we could easily hop into a cab (always obligingly called by the friendly, helpful reception staff). Free computer use, lavish breakfast buffet (eggs and fruit as well as cereals and waffles), small but sparkling pool, guest laundry, all day hot and cold drinks in lobby, spacious, clean room with loads of room for husband in wheelchair - this was an oasis after the pricey mid-town hotels we had been staying in. We walked to the Old Town for a superb Mexican lunch on the hottest day on record and used our stay to relax. Top marks to staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GBQ
Reviews.Content: If you have a car, this motel is a very good choice. Its location further out of downtown is not a problem as the Pacific Highway gets you downtown in less than 10 minutes. Walking distance to Old Town and Transit Centre. But most important, the service and value are outstanding. You can even borough DVDs for free! Complimentary breakfast is great and staff is extremely pleasant. Our neighbors were noisy, and the walls were thins, but I guess you can be unlucky that way in any other motels or hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn is San diego's pearl”
Reviews.Author: SCken
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Old Town Inn off and on since 2003 while on travel. My company's local office reccomended it the first time and since then this is the first place I look for reservations. The front desk staff are ALWAYS pleasant, helpful and pretty knowledgeable of San Diego, its attractions, where to eat (important for a working guy) and directions to various businesses and Navy bases that I have to visit. Although at first look from the street you wonder where you are you quickly realize you are in the right place- it is fairly quite, close to the trolley and bus which are excellent transportation in SD, and not far from places to eat or the Sports Arena for all the events there. I give them my highest recommendation to anyone considering staying at Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Strange location but good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBertie
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when we first saw the location of the Old Town Inn but had our doubts quickly eased by the front desk staff's friendly service. It's not a dangerous area but the motel's industrial surroundings give it a slightly iffy feel. It's close to the historic Old Town district and within walking distance of public transport and major roads. Our room was small but not cramped, clean, and the bed was comfortable. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with a reasonable variety of options. Free internet on the computer in the lobby was a plus not included at many more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The right place for the right price”
Reviews.Author: KarMar10
Reviews.Content: The Inn is centrally located and within an easy 2 block walking distance to Old Town; however, is not on the pretty side of the tracks (is not in Old Town). That makes the prices right. Staff is friendly and helpful, the place is nicely landscaped, and the rooms clean and very comfortable. We opted for the economy rooms in the older portion of the motel. They had character, were updated, with great showers, but not a lot of surplus space. That's fine as we were out and about sightseeing for the vast majority of the day, and did not hang around long. Breakfast was included, was more than fine, but was not fancy. And there were no additional charges for parking as we saw on a lot of SD motels / hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful cozy setting with very helpful, generous & courteous employees”
Reviews.Author: Gina45888
Reviews.Content: It is centraly located in the heart of San Diego. You are 5 min. from Downtown, Point Loma, OB, Mission Beach......so many wonderful places to see and do and the hotel is like an oasis tropical setting. Pool setting is very clean and beautiful too! The breakfast that is served for free has a wide variety of choices to choose from too. Homemade waffles, bagels, cereal, muffins, O.J. coffee and lovely lemon water. This is my second stay at the hotel the first was w/my family and now with my girlfriend. I will definitely be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Services and Good Price in CA”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Lai
Reviews.Content: I stay this hotel for 4 nights. The services offered by this hotel are good enough. The room may be not luxury but it is "what price you pay = what you get". As a new visitor in San Diego, this hotel will be a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for the price”
Reviews.Author: amz1
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I have just returned from a weeks stay at the Old Town Inn. We certainly have no complaints . The location is excellent for getting to the beaches and downtown as its just across the road from the transit centre. Quite rightly it is on an industrial estate but it didn't bother us. I'm not sure how anyone can say it's not close to the old town, it's just across the road! The grounds of the hotel and the rooms are very clean. The only small complaint i woud have about the rooms is that there isn't a fridge. However, they do provide a plastic container in the room to fill with ice to keep your wine cool! The hotel staff have to be the most helpful I have ever come across. I asked them many questions about public transport etc, and they never got annoyed and would ring the bus company or look online in order to help me out. Other nices touches to the hotel are that you are given a nice selection of travel toiletries upon arrival and the free coffee in the reception is also good. The breakfast was also great!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend for anyone who wants to spend their money on fun, not fancy.”
Reviews.Author: PlainOleTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with extended family during a Marine Corps Graduation. (3rd generation, including both parents!) It was a great value, albeit strange-sounding location. All weirdness aside (yes, this place in sandwiched between a highway - we heard nothing - and an industrial area) we were truly within walking distance to Old Town, even for someone who is normally fairly paranoid about cities and crime. In fact, we checked the crime map and most of the local crime is from a nearby street and involved inebriated servicemembers. I'm OK with that. We were in a room with a mini-stovetop, microwave and fridge. Perfect if you want to spend your money on fun and events, not eating in a restaurant for every meal. This wouldn't be a hotel for someone who wants to spend $2-3 hundred a night for luxury accommodations. This would be a great hotel for someone who wants a convenient, great value hotel room. If you're in San Diego to do something other than sit in a hotel, seriously consider The Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not in Old Town!”
Reviews.Author: ArtWalkingLen
Reviews.Content: Despite its name, this hotel is not in Old Town, nor is it very close. It is in a very noisy location (by a busy hwy and train line), there are no restaurants nearby, or anywhere to go at night. The rooms were aging (hair drying broken, A/C very noisy), and the pool does not include a hot tub, etc. The wireless internet worked most of the time, but the 3rd party provider was rude when I did have problems.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice little place, in a busy location"”
Reviews.Author: CCKPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I spent two nights here after moving from another place in Hotel Circle. I wish we had stayed here all the time! Our room and bathroom were small, but very nice and clean. This was one of the room across from the lovely pool. The free breakfast exceded our expectations, and we were able to take it and eat it by the pool side. The staff was very helpful and kind at all times. Close to Old Town, but didn't feel safe to walk at night. I'll definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice find. Clean, cozy and central to everything”
Reviews.Author: Steve1602
