Pacific Hwy is a 6 lane road and there is a freeway nearby. It didn't bother me in the least as there didn't seem to be much traffic on the PH. Will I go there again. Yes, and soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Famiilytrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-March and rented a total of 4 rooms for our extended family. The inn is clean, well-run, and a great value. We stayed in the newer section of the inn and the rooms were more than adequate. Our room had a refrigerator and microwave, although the rooms with 2 double beds did not-probably because there was less space there. A small inconvenience. We stayed a total of six nights and found the front desk people helpful and pleasant. The location is convenient although not in the fanciest section of town. The inn was fully booked on several of the nights and the parking lot and breakfast room do get crowded, but no real problem-we took our breakfast around the pool one day. Any complaints about the breakfast were made by nit-pickers; the food is plentiful and more than adequate. We will definitely stay here again. Tip: Have dinner at the Old Venice Cafe and Restaurant-great food-be sure to get a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bigelowfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn for one night prior to going to the airport the next morning. We just needed a basic, clean place to crash for a few hours. The hotel room was just that - very basic - but the price was right. We wouldn't recommend this hotel for a long stay, but for one night it was just fine. The pool was small but fine. It was a really windy day so there were some leaves and other tree stuff in the water but it wasn't the hotel's fault. The room had a weird cleaning product smell but we just opened the window for a while and then it was OK. It's right across the street from Old Town which is why we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay strictly for economy, not for comfort”
Reviews.Author: redlucy599
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Old Town Inn on March 22-March 23, 2007. I found the staff to be polite, and the rooms to be clean. There are no in-room amenities aside from a small bar of soap, and a small shampoo (bring your blow dryer and if you are looking for coffee forget it). There are two sides to the Inn (one appears to have been renovated recently) and my room was located on the older side. It was a business trip and was located near Old Town and within walking distance of Taylor Street where I needed to be the following morning. The Inn is poorly located on the very busy Pacific Highway, and there is nothing to look at except for the I-8 Freeway overpass, the rail & bus transit center located directly underneath the overpass of I-8, and a very large Warehouse type building (Naval & Space Warship Facility of some sort) directly across the street. Very noisy area, thin walls and strange configuration from the lobby to the older part of the Inn (two different driveways, very confusing). Cable TV was horrible (didn't come in very well), but the Continental Breakfast was satisfactory. Stay here only if you are looking to save on cash. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyLifeAlways
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Everything was great. Good selection at breakfast. . In room had coffee maker, blow dryer, reading chair with floor lamp, desk/chair, nice pillows. Plenty of room to get around. 2 sinks to use - 1 in bathroom and 1 just outside bathroom with a long vanity - easier for 2 people to get ready. Nice room arrangement. The walls are thin, but the people beside us and above were not bothersome at all. People seem to all settle down early at nite and not too early to rise in the a.m.. Maybe with the knowledge of thin walls people were actually quieter. Convenient to Old Town and the trolley tour. Did have to walk down and up some stairs to get across to Old Town, but it was well lit with security cameras and buttons. Office help were very nice and helpful. Would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, staff and location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travegmommy
Reviews.Content: After searching the internet for a couple weeks, I finally decided to book a night here for our trip to sea world. I could'nt believe how extremely close we were. I have to admit when we got off the freeway we were a little nervous on what to expect but to our surprise the hotel looked beautifully landscaped, clean and as we walked into the front desk it was as cozy as can be . We especially loved the breakfast the next morning. The only thing I have to reccomend is to stay on a top floor because of the thin walls and be prepared to have the smell of cigarrettes in your non-smoking room. Who knows maybe youll have better luck than i did.I was told it was problably someone from the night before. After all this i will most likey come back. My kids loved the night swimming and the central location of this hotel. Can't beat the price too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum-From-OH
Reviews.Content: We loved The Old Town-Inn. It was very clean, convenient to everything, very affordable and the staff was very friendly. They even have a computer with Internet in the lobby to use which was convenient to look up directions or to book reservations for tours, etc. The breakfast was great which really saved us quite a bit of money by eating there everyday. The beds were really comfortable and the pillows were fluffy. If you are wanting a CLEAN motel at a very affordable price, this is the place. When I originally made my reservations they did not have a room for our entire stay. They were full on one night of the last weekend we were to be there so I booked it until that last weekend of our stay and had backup reservations somewhere else for the remainder of our stay. We checked in and stayed for a few days, then went to LA for a couple of days and when we came back and checked in they had a cancellation and we were able to stay there for the remainder of our stay. We were so glad!!! If I were to go back to San Diego I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: TT40
Reviews.Content: While the price was certainly right ($65) I think I would recommend something a little more upscale if it's in your budget. We stayed for a few nights and here were our findings: Great price, very clean with friendly efficient staff and a workstation with free internet access in the lobby. Overall the property was very well taken care of. On the downside, our room was very small (even for just one parent and one kid) and while we didn't hear traffic (even though it is located on a 'highway'), we could pretty much hear conversation and noise from rooms next door. Overall, it was alright but I think we'd stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, New friends”
Reviews.Author: donfranchesco
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip to San Diego and calling hotels for information and suggestions, what I received was a handful of employees who were rude or uninterested. After many attempts to find a friendly representative I called the Old Town Inn and spoke with Anna Flores. She was cheerful, extremely helpful and informative. She not only assisted me with my reservations she also provided me with detailed directions and information of the area and offered to answer any further questions and recommended areas of interest to visit! In addition, she suggested local restaurants for me to try, which, after a long day can be extremely useful to know since I wanted good food without the hassle of driving any long distance. The entire staff was helpful and I enjoyed my trip immensely. If your looking for an upscale hotel you can expect to pay top dollar, however, if you wish to stay at a friendly, clean, close to Old Town and the freeways then this is the place to stay. After this visit I feel welcomed to return and look very much to seeing my new friend Anna and asking her many questions without feeling as if I imposing on her time. Thank you Anna and the entire staff of the Old Town Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Suited Us Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: escondido
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice, small hotel close to the Sports Arena, as we were in San Diego for one night only for a concert there. The staff was friendly & efficient, the room was clean & relatively quiet. The free breakfast was more than sufficient. The location was very convenient to the freeway & the Arena, as well as countless dinner choices. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay, & a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: ksabbeth
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to San Diego before. I found the Old Town Inn by looking at reviews on various websites. Overall, I was very pleased. with my stay. When we first approached the hotel, I was concerned because it seemed to be in an area almost under the highway, but it's really not, and the location was actually very convenient. We could walk to Old Town for dinner, and the central location was great for driving to the zoo, Coranado, and a wedding we attended on Vacation Island. When we pulled up to the hotel itself, I sensed that it would be a nice place. The buildings are nicely designed and have a cheery but homey look to them. The staff members were helpful and very sweet. They recommended a good pedicure place and a fun (though not superb) Mexican restaurant. They also sold us discounted tickets to the zoo (which was great, by the way.) The complimentary breakfast --waffles, choices of cereal, danish, some fruit, etc.-- was filling and pretty decent though not excellent (the fruit wasn't great, just some apples and oranges, but I'm kind of a food snob so don't weigh my view on this too heavily) . The little dining room was light and cheery, and the pool is nice too. While not super-fancy, the rooms were clean and tasteful. The linens were good, though not luxurious. The toiletries (soap, shampoo, etc.) were probably the only disappointment, but, like lots of people, I'd brought my own anyway. The towels were more than ample. I would definitely return to the Old Town Inn. Although the rooms do not come equipped with luxuries (no mints on the pillows or fancy soaps), everything they do provide is very nice, and the staff was lovely. It is an excellent choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: northofsouthfarms
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for three nights after having stayed at the Candy Cane Inn( which we loved) in Anaheim for 7 nights. The rooms were pleasant however they were lacking many items. There was no fridge, safe and the rollaway bed they brought us was probably thirty years old. The staff was pleasant when we booked in, gave us great maps for getting around and arranged for us to have extra pillows and blankets. Our room was near the road and we heard everything. Unless we had the air conditioning on high we had a hard time sleeping. I slept well in Anaheim but after the second night at the Old Town Inn both my husband and I had sore backs. I was tired after sleeping at the Inn. The rooms were clean and nicely appointed, however our rollaway bed was never made the three nights we spent there. The breakfast was just okay, the first morning we had to go find staff to restock as there was nothing left and it was still quite early with a lot of people standing around waiting for food. The breakfast room is small and they ask you not to eat outside of the breakfast room. I'm not sure where you should eat if you can't get a table. ( standing up, I guess). The pool is fine and clean. There is no hot tub. Parking became difficult if you were one of the last in the parking lot. It is small and difficult to manage. We would have rated our stay okay until we went to check out. We had checked in using our CAA Visa Travellers Cheque Card. They accepted this and yet when we went to check out they told us they could not accept this ( even though we had no problems with our other hotel, restaurants and shops for the last 10 days). We had to go and get cash from the bank. When we returned home, we notice on the statement, they had put the money through on our Visa when we checked in and then taken our cash at check out. This has been resolved but only after calling them . Apparently the girl who checked us in should not have accepted our card. We spoke with our CAA and Visa and they said they have never had anyone reject this card. It is the same as a travellers cheque but in the form of a card which makes it much easier to use. Old Town Inn is the only hotel which we know of that does not accept it. I think perhaps the Inn should get up to date on new payment methods. Would I return? No. And obviously I would not recommend this to anyone else. The inn was okay but the check out definetly turned me off. I'm sure there are other hotels in San Diego where you can get a better nights sleep and more up to date staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: RebelsFan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a great stay. After reading the great reviews I was concerned I was setting myself up for disappointment. Not to worry. Our stay was very nice and exceeded our expectations. I was greeted by Maria who provided my family with the quiet room we asked for and when asked for some Mexican dining tips over at nearby Old Town she kindly provided me with a map and 3 great suggestions, two of which we used and were very happy with. Anna is like a San Diego travel agent and gave me great advice on visiting "over the boarder" and on Sea World. My kids loved the beautiful pool, and the breakfast room is a great way to start the day. My opinion.... ignore any negative comments you read here. The staff here aim to please, and if things are not right (hey things happen) I am confident they will do there best to make it right given the chance. It is not the Hyatt, but it is not $350.00 plus per night either. And they do not charge for internet, $9.00 for a juice and bagel, or $20.00 flat fee for a 2 minute long distance call to Canada like the Hyatt does either. I would stay here again anytime. Thanks Anna, Maria, and staff! Great Job.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Torontoteacher
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in San Diego for a week. It had to be close to a trolley station so that we could get by without a car. It also needed to be clean, quiet and affordable. After weeks of searching and reading reviews of hotels, I was beginning to feel that I would never find the perfect hotel. Then I stumbled on the reviews for Old Town Inn. It sounded just perfect for what we wanted. I called the hotel and the person on the phone was extremely polite and helpful. So we booked in for a week. When we showed up, I wondered if it would be as good as it had sounded. And it was. The Trip Advisor reviews had been right on. It was a real find!! We had a delux room with a kitchenette. The room was very spacious with a sofa and coffee table. We would have preferred to have a table and chairs rather than a desk with an extra chair drawn up to it, but that was a small thing. If you book a kitchenette, it does not come with the dishes, etc in the room. You have to ask at the front desk and they will deliver a large case full of dishes, utensils, dishclothes, detergent, etc. But if we were to do it over, we would have not spent the extra few dollars for the kitchen unit. Each unit has a microwave and fridge, so we really didn't need the gas burners. We could have saved the extra 5 dollars a day and just bought some paper plates. The bed was really comfortable and the room was very quiet. One of the best things about the hotel is the location. It is a 5 minute walk to the bus and trolley station. From there we were able to get to anywhere we wanted cheaply and easily. A day pass was only 15 dollars for 4 days so you can't beat the price!! The Old Town area is right next to the trolley station, so we were able to wander around there whenever we wanted. There was an Italian restaurant by the trolley station that had a 5 dollar pizza special each day. So we were able to take it home and have a delicious dinner for next to nothing. The breakfast at the Old Town Inn was truly amazing. Yes, technically it was a deluxe continuental breakfast. But it had make yourself hot waffles and hard boiled eggs, so there was a lot of variety. They also had tea, coffee, hot chocolate, juice, yogurt,fresh fruit, fruit salad, assorted cold cereals, instant oatmeal, about 5 types of bagels, 4 types of danishes, toast, etc. We were there for a week and I doubt we repeated the same breakfast choices. The meal filled us up enough that we rarely needed lunch. It is also a really nice breakfast room, so we often stayed and chatted with our friends for an hour. It was definitely the nicest continental buffet I have had at a hotel. The hotel wasn't cheap, but was on a par with what all the other chain hotels were charging. But our friends wanted to save a few bucks so they had booked one of the hotel's economy rooms. These rooms are fairly small, but they are able to fit in a table and 2 chairs. They also had a fridge and microwave. Their bathroom was small, but did not have a hairdryer. But since they were not planning to spend too much time in their room aside from sleeping, they felt it was fine for their needs. Their bed was also super comfortable. They paid about 20 dollars a night less. If I was staying for just one night or if I wanted to save a bit of money, I would not hesitate to stay in the economy room. They are currently renovating rooms in that wing, so there was a bit of extra construction noise earlier in the day for them. But if you don't mind the extra cost, go for the bigger deluxe room. I think it was worth it. There were several restaurants within a ten minute walk fo the hotel, so we really didn't miss having a car. On days when we were out all day at Sea World, etc, we often stopped on our way back for dinner and then just hopped on the next trolley or bus. That is the benefit of the day pass!! We are already planning another trip to San Diego, and we will definitely staying at the Old Town Inn. It is a real gem of a hotel. The staff is top notch. Nothing was too much trouble and their attitude was great. I also loved being able to use the lobby computer to check my emails. The hotel has a very spacious and comfortable lobby with a fireplace. The Old Town Inn is an oasis in the middle of an industrial area. We never felt unsafe. Even though it is near to a highway, the hotel is very quiet. I can't imagine anyone complaining about anything at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cheap but clean - hence the bargain”
Reviews.Author: saberman
Reviews.Content: I wanted an affordable place to sleep close to USD, the airport, Seaworld and convenitent to the rest of San Diego attractions. I only paid about 65 bucks for the night in a room with 2 double beds within a row of a motel like structure, which is likely the older of the structures on the property. I was tired and did not notice the traffic from the nearby street and close elevated I-5. No noise from neighbors and a clean room made this a bargain. It was indeed convenient. A car is still a good idea in SD. However, nearby are bus and trolley routes. On arrival about 4 PM, I noticed a very strong "room freshener" which was definitely overdone. My advice to the hotel is to insure that non-smoking rooms are absoulutely maintained non-smoking and that room fresheners be far more subtle and sparingly used. The bathroom was 1950s design with a small shower stall, toilet and small updated vanity. The two double beds would be adequate up to a 6 foot tall person but not beyond. If you are tall get aroom with a queen bed. The decor had a cheerful bedspread and paint scheme. TV was very basic cable. The lobby was warm and welcoming as was the staff. There is only one person at the desk. If more than one person is ready to check in or out there will be a wait, so don't wait until the last minute to leave. The breaksfast was adequate and convenient self serve. Bagels, dry cereal, instant oatmeal, pastries and make your own waffles. The waffle batter was bland to paper mache' in flavor and texture - might be improved with a longer cook time and perhaps a different batter. One piece of advice to the staff - get a sneeze guard and keep the food out of children's reach. We observed one hacking, sneezing child spreading her germs over the pastries and bagels. We stuck with the non-descript waffles. Eating breakfast out may be worth it. All in all, if you just need a convenient place to flop, this place works out well. Just don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “There's good news and there's bad news...”
Reviews.Author: HopSkipJump
Reviews.Content: Bottom line, this is a very pleasant place to stay and was convenient for us since we were visiting the U of SD and Sea World. The bad news... In general, there was a bunch of little things that were kind of annoying for us, We are two men in our 40s that rented 2 rooms (a small one and a larger one (the larger one had a kitchen and sofabed as well as a queen)-- both non-smoking) 1. The first "larger room" they gave me had a strong cigarette smoke smell. The carpet actually had cigarette burns in it in spite of the fact that this was supposed to be a non-smoking room. 2. I was transferred to another room (no smoke smell) but it (and my friend's room) both had a perfumy/disinfectant kind of smell that we both found unpleasant. (Perhaps, it's that Fabreze stuff and you might not mind it but both of us left the windows open to get rid of it).. The second room also had cigarette burns in it (these were on the blanket). In addition, the back of the door to the room had some heavy scratches and dents on it as if something heavy had been thrown against it. 3. When I returned later to my room, and turned on the tap to brush my teeth, there was an overpoweringly strong sulphur smell (rotten eggs smell) coming out of the tap. 4. I went to buy bottled water and the vending machine I tried was out of water; the second one stole my money and failed to dispense my water. 5. When we arrived, The pool had a sign on it saying that the water heater was broken although I saw people swimming in it later in the day who said it was warm. 6. The "make your own" waffles for breakfast were pretty tastelss and the cereal had a stale taste. The cereal was dispensed from large glass jars via scoops. I thought it strange that the scoops were stored by hanging them by the scoop-part (not by the handle) on the wooden knobs that were screwed into the center of the jar lids. In this way, every "dirty" hand that came in contact with a jar lid -- and left its germs on the lid's knob --resulted in those germs being transferred to the scoop which in turn was repeatedly inserted into the jar. (Yeech!). I believe that the reason the cereal tasted stale was that the jars were never emptied and washed -- just re-filled from time to time. 7. The remarks of the prior posters notwithstanding, there was some traffic noise from the street. My room was about 1/2 way back from the driveway entrance and you could still hear some noise in the distance (with the windows closed). It didn't disturb me -- I feel asleep easily but it might affect light sleepers, especially if your room was closer to the street. FYI, the smaller rooms (what they call "the bungalows) are farther away from the street than the larger rooms. in general. Ok, the good news... 1. The lobby was very nice -- there was the fireplace and attractive furnishings. 2. Check-in was a snap. Mary at reception (who later changed my room) was a delight as was everyone who worked there. 3. The rooms were very nicely' decorated: even the smaller room was nice -- the only slight drawback was the smaller room's bath which had the "original tile" which while clean looked a little old.. 4. Everyone who worked there was very helpful and kind. When I lost my money in the soda machine, the deskclerk led me to the third machine (in the laundry room) and gave me the money I had lost. 5. The Orange Juice and tea at breakfast was tasty. I did not try the bagels but they were large and lots of people appeared to be enjoying them. I've sinced talked to a plumber who told me that the "sulpur smell" that I experienced (which was not in the shower, btw) could have resulted from a recent plumbing repair and probably would go away in a week or less. All in all, I'd rate it 3-1/2 stars (if that were possible). The hotel was completely sold out both days we were there so I'm sure they had their hands full.

Reviews.Title: “Very Low Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBanker12
Reviews.Content: After seeing the mostly high ratings, I thought to give this a try for a one night stay. This was a HUGE mistake. My wife and I enjoy going to Old Town and have stayed at various hotels around the area, and without a doubt this hotel has to be the worst. At first glance, the place looked okay, however when we got there, the person behind the counter decided that taking reservations was more important then us, so they continued to take 2 reservations over the phone as 4 groups lined up behind us. As other reviewers have mentioned, there are two sides to this hotel. The registration side looks great and the lobby was very nice, but then we were assigned a room to the dreaded "other" side. This other side honestly looked like something out of a bad horror movie. It looked awful. I mean talk about 180 degrees difference from the other side. The room was ridiculously small, and there were creaks and cracks with everything we did. The worst part, I thought, was the noise. If someone stopped in front of our room to talk, it was like they were in the room with us it was so loud. The bangs from other doors, and other rooms kept us up pretty much all night. As I said, we have stayed in various locations throughout Old Town, I would avoid this one at all costs. It was the loudest, and dirtiest out of anything we have seen. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget”
Reviews.Author: jamesoz1
Reviews.Content: The trip advisor board led us here,a good choice.Stayed here Jan.5-8 and again Jan 19-21. Both times in the older sections for $58 to $65 ,depending on room and day of week. Nicely landscaped gardens and pool area(heated),good expanded continental brkfst.cereal,rolls,muffins,toast,bagels,waffles,h-boiled eggs,coffee,juice,hot choc,tea,milk. Didnt have my computer,so dont remember if all rooms have internet access,but there is a computer in the lobby for guest use which worked out fine. Great staff,especially,Mary and Maria,who seemed to be working most often when we were in the lobby,also always someone outside sweeping,cleaning pool,trimming,just keeping the place nice. Rooms very clean and pillow top beds comfy for hotel beds.Laundry available. Walk 2 blocks to Old Town or couple more blocks to the left for plenty of dining ,shopping options. (Guadalajara in OT or theres Sizzler on Rosecrantz that are decent choices.Dont forget a fish taco from Rubios while you're there)Driving easy also,but may have to cruise the parking lots in old town for a spot at certain times of the day. Desk has printed directions for both walking locally,or driving to most anything in San Diego. Commuter train,trolley,busses also right there at entrance to old town.Entry to I-8/I-5 or downtown on Pacific Hwy all convenient .Found driving SD quite easy from here. There is factory looking military (SpacWar) spacewar? complex across the street,but no noise or traffic problems resulted. Overall great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: aj1a
Reviews.Content: This is def a gem of an Inn. Now, first off, I was hesitant of the place after seeing a room other than the one we stayed in as well as the weird location of the Inn. But I have to say, this is a great find and I'm glad I followed the advise of other tripadvisors! The location is awes...it couldn't get any better. The location of this hotel is literally RIGHT next to the tranportation depot and within walking distance to Old Town. There are great little shops and restaurants in this area and instead of going downtown like we had planned, my fiance and I spent the whole weekend in Old Town. No need for a car or worrying about parking. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was great and the staff was VERY accomodating. I was even able to get the wireless internet from my room (#305). I have to give a shout out to Oke (not sure if that is spelled right) as we had a bit of an experience when we first arrived. Our flight was five hours late so instead of getting there at 9:30pm, we arrived at 2:30am. He was very pleasant and when we realized the room we had been booked with was not what we were looking for, he happily moved us to another location as well as comp'd us for our troubles and pretty much missing the first nights stay. By the time we got to the room and to bed it was 4am. The bed was sooo comfy though (pillowtop) so I was able to get a good nights sleep. Even though I was given a smoking room (that was all that was left to accomodate my needs), it really was not a bad room and didn't smell as bad as it could have. I will DEF stay here when I come back. You cannot ask for a better deal in pricey San Diego. Hopefully this hotel will stay true to it's colors and not let big business drive their prices up. Thanks Old Town Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: CLwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Old Town at the end of the holiday season. We found that it was a reasonable alternative to staying in a pricey hotel in downtown SD, which after all is only a few miles away. The room was pleasant and the breakfast was quite good - you can make your own waffles. We didn't walk to the Old Town or the trolley stop - those things are fairly close but you have to cross a wide street. If you had small children or any kind of mobility issue it might not seem too close! Our teenagers used the pool - apparently it was warm enough for them, even in Dec. No hot tub though. The people in the office were helpful with recommendations for restaurants and also for directions in the immediate area. This was refreshing - too many smaller hotels seem to have staff members who don't know anything about the area around the hotel. We got more than we expected at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dawn07
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from a 17-day tour at California. This must be our best stay ever among all the lodgings i had picked from Tripadvisor's List! This is truly a gem in San Diego! Besides affordable room price, their service is rated top compared to some star-rated hotels that i had stayed with. Clean, spacious deluxe room, all basic amentities met, friendly staff -Marie, Anna who assisted us during check-in & out, always greet us with a smile whenever we passed by reception! Love their breakfast spread! Waffles, cereal, muffin, danish and boiled eggs energized us every morning! Though situated at Pacific Hwy, there's no noise issue as mentioned in previous posts. A most strategic location for tourists, easy accessible to almost any atttraction- Seaworld, san diego zoo, beaches and downtown. I would highly recommend Old Town Inn to anyone who need a top quality accomodation in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, unbeatable price”
Reviews.Author: Darlox
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is located directly across the street from San Diego's Old Town State Park, including its trolley, bus and train transit hub. I was in town for a business meeting, and this hotel turned out to be an excellent choice! The hotel is spread out over 3 buildings, each with 2-3 floors. Some of the rooms are currently being renovated, and orignally I was assigned to a room that was under construction. After returning to the desk, they immediately apologized and even gave me a complimentary upgrade to a better room class. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. Parking is free, but the hotel is located right on the Pacific Highway, so you can only enter and exit the property from the southbound direction. You have to go a couple of blocks and either turn onto a side street or pull a U-turn if you're heading north. It's basically just around the corner from "Hotel Circle", so if you're meeting other people who are staying there, it's less than a 5-minute drive. It's also a lot nicer than some Hotel Circle properties I've stayed in! The hotel has free wireless Internet that was easily reachable from my room, though apparently not all rooms have a clear signal. The price was unbeatable! About _half_ of what a franchise hotel near the airport or downtown was going for, and the quality was certainly comparable. Add in the free parking, and easy access to the trolley, and this hotel is just an unbelievable deal. To be fair, it's definitely not a luxury property! The room was a little heavy on the deodorizer, the bed was a bit soft, and the shower could have been better. But it's clean, functional, and all-in-all one of the better experiences I've had with hotels in the San Diego area. None of its shortcomings were actually problems -- just some room for improvement. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You ...TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: imoran
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to San Diego. We wanted a place that was centrally located to the tourist attractions,the beach, and Old Town. The Old Town Inn was the perfect hotel. The great price, free internet access, and a excellent breakfast made this small hotel a big hit.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal!”
Reviews.Author: GreatTravler
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is a good deal! In searching for a hotel in San Diego in the $120-$150 range that recieved good TripAdvisor reviews, I found the Old Town Inn for under $90.00 a night. The reviews were very good and, in my experience, very accurate. It is near enough to Old Town to walk, though you do have to walk under the freeway. My daughter and I were not uncomfortable making the walk in the evenings. May I recommend Cafe Guadalajara on Taylor St at the edge of Old Town. We rented a car and the Old Town Inn is centrally located to the area points of interest with easy access to the freeway. It was very clean throughout the property and has been well maintained. We used a deluxe room that was on the 3rd floor at the back of the property. There was some traffic and airport noise, but nothing the "fan only" on the AC couldn't mask. The breakfast buffet was well-stocked with a waffle machine, bagels, sweet rolls, oatmeal, etc. All in all, the Old Town Inn is a real bargain. If we ever return to San Diego, I will definitely stay at the Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Anna”
Reviews.Author: NWmailman
Reviews.Content: I've never left a review before, but my experience here requires it. I was dubious of the location...it was perfect. 2 blks walking distance to Old Town. Plus, it was right on Pacific...just minutes from downtown. Sergio, the nite clerk said, "Call in the morning and ask for Anna...she'll fix you up." He was right. She was a delight and ever so helpful in ways to numerous to mention, all with a great smile! The breakfast was the best Continental I've had. Great variety. The room was quite large, a nice efficiency, all utensils provided. We had a concern one evening about loud talking and smoking on the balcony outside...a polite mention and it was discreetly handled. 1 mile from several retail centers with many specialty shops and restaurants. Try Barons for specialty foods and don't miss the Flea Market Fri.-Sun. at the Sports Arena nearby. It's a buck and has it all. Ask for Anna, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value, excellant location”
Reviews.Author: m0z
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn during the second week of October, the Hotel is spotlessly clean with great amenities which include a swimming pool, laundry, free Internet access in the reception area and a decent size car park. The hotel is well placed for the tourist as the local transport links are about 3 minutes walk from the hotel, here you can catch a bus, train, taxi, street car or the modern local transport tram giving you a massive choice of easy to reach activities which include the Mexican border. We stayed in one of the older rooms at the hotel which are situated next to the pool area, these rooms are compact, clean and adequately furnished, they are seconds from the pool, reception area and breakfast room. The staff at the hotel were friendly and more than helpful when assisting with any enquiries or advice on places to visit, you are also able to buy your zoo and sea-world tickets at a discount rate from the front desk. This hotel is perfect for a vacation in San Diego and for the price an absolute steal....give it a try you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Maxteach1
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I stayed here in June of 2005 and it was a great bargain for the price. It is not a 5 star hotel, but that's not what we were looking for. It was close to everything that we wanted to do, including Sea World, OId Town, and the San Diego Zoo. We didn't use the pool, but it looked nice. I liked being able to park right near our room, and the continental breakfast was a plus. Some people mention that this is not a safe area, but we never felt uncomfortable. San Diego is a big city, so most areas can be considered a little bit unsafe. We paid about $90 a night for our room, which also had a refrigerator and a microwave. This past summer, we ended up staying at the Residence Inn in Hotel Circle only because we wanted a two room suite and Old Town Inn was already booked for their family suites. Unfortunately we paid twice what we paid at the Old Town Inn and the suite was not that special. I would recommend the Old Town Inn to anyone looking for a comfortable home base for all of the San Diego attractions. You'll be close to everything, and you'll save a bundle, so you'll have a little bit extra to spend of souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “the old town inn”
Reviews.Author: RDABGA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the old town inn for 3 nights and had a great visit to wonderful San Diego. The hotel is a great deal for the price. It is located near Old Town and is within walking distance. The trolley is within walking distance ( public transportation that will take you all over the San Diego area). The room was clean and well taken care of. The staff was outstanding and very helpful. The pool area was nice and the pool is heated. I noticed there was a BBQ in that area I assume it was there for guest use but I didn't inquire any further. We stayed in a room with a microwave and refrigerator. I dont think all the rooms are equiped with them but it was nice to have them available. The room had a hair dryer and iron and ironing board. There are not hookups for your computer but we were able to get a signal in our room since it was near the office. There was a breakfast every morning 6a to 10a. Which was more than enough to hold us until lunch. Overrall we had a great time. The inn is located not far from everthing we wanted to see(we had a car) It is not far from the I-5. and only 1-2 exits from Seaworld. The location worked well for us and all we did. We will stay at the Old town inn next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for price”
Reviews.Author: hppygilmore
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Downtown San Diego was easily accessible from the hotel. Old Town was within walking distance. The continental breakfast was more than your average continental breakfast, you can cook your own waffles and it lasted us until the afternoon. I have stayed at top of the line hotel and this room was the same size. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: jenbran
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past Friday night after desperately searching for a reasonably priced room close to downtown. This one had the best reviews on TripAdvisor so we took the chance. It's true, the location is odd, but it didn't inconvenience us in any way. 2 minute drive to Old Town restaurants. Rooms are big and clean, pool is large, well kept and sunny. Breakfast is simple but nice bonus. Free internet access in lobby was great too. Would definitely stay here again. Liked this better than Westin Horton Plaza which as 3 times as expensive and a lot less clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option! Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: KC999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a place to stay for just one night in San Diego and we had an early morning flight the next day. We did not want to spend a lot of money, and we stay in 4 and 5 star hotels often and travel quite frequently. Also, other members of my family were staying 2 nights. We had two rooms - our room was the economy room and my family members' room was a larger room. Both rooms were extremely clean, quiet, and quite nice. It was exactly what we needed. The service upon reception was very friendly and courteous - they were quite helpful. They even helped my family find a rental car the next day and answer other questions about the area. Although I did not have breakfast, my relatives did, and said that it was quite good and more than enough to eat and satisfied them through late in the afternoon. The pool area is very pleasant. If I had stayed longer, I would definitely have spent some time there. All in all, other hotels in San Diego are very expensive, and if you are looking for somewhere to stay that is less money, clean, and good service, I don't think you will find a better option than the Old Town Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: jjrogers
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this one after reading all the reviews. Wasn't sure what to expect from the "industrial" area supposedly surrounding the Inn. We could not have been happier with our choice. Clean, clean, clean-- and we can be particular about that! Moreover, the Old Town Inn was like an oasis- beautifully landscaped with lush foliage, fountains, and a well-maintained pool area. Convenient to everything, especially Sea World (great for us, since we bought the 5 day pass!). We only used a half-tank of gas for the whole week and probably could have gotten by on much less if not for a foray to the Wild Animal Park. An easy walk into Old Town made this great for late-night dining, too. Breakfast, while not gourmet, managed to fill us up just fine with plenty of good choices-- waffles, bagels, hard-boiled eggs, and oatmeal. That in itself probably saved us an arm and a leg in food costs, doubling the value of this wonderful budget lodging. By the way, we stayed in one of the older economy rooms with a microwave and fridge (they call them "bungalows"), and enjoyed it very much. We were in 141, the end unit, which afforded us plenty of privacy and was away from the noise of the pool. The gentleman at the desk said the bungalows had been renovated recently, and they looked very nice to us. Small, yes, but "cozy" was the word my husband used-- very comfortable, even for a week's stay. We miss the beautiful Old Town Inn already and intend to go back in the future! Who would have guessed that the cheapest option in San Diego would also be the best?!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended Inn”
Reviews.Author: germar
Reviews.Content: This hotel ranked 2nd out of 5 hotels my wife and I stayed at during our honeymoon week in the US. We decided to stay here based on comments posted below, and were not disappointed. Parking was indeed a bit tight, but there were far more positives than negatives. On arrival, we were assigned R#144, behind the property and with its own parking spaces. Our room was furthest from the road, so we enjoyed a quiet night. We requested an to stay an extra night, but this required us to move to R#128, which was right beside the road, so was a bit noisy. Also, instead of having a queen bed, the room had two doubles, which meant that 1) the air-con was placed directly next to one bed, freezing the occupant, and 2) the configuration didn’t allow for a fridge in this room (#144 had a fridge). However, the hotel is located along a very quiet road, so there wasn’t much noise. In fact, the whole area looked deserted, which was very off-putting at night, until we were directed to a 10-minute walk behind the hotel where all the shops and restaurants were. Staff at this hotel are very very friendly, and the breakfast is, indeed, exceptionally above what one would expect. Also very nice was the computer in the lobby with free internet access for guest use. The hotel is near the airport but far from downtown San Diego; however, it is still easy to reach with the nearby trolley service. A nice hotel which I will be happy to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Splurge...don't go economy!”
Reviews.Author: yuckybeans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight here in an economy room. It was very small, but very clean. Great service upon check-in and wonderful breakfast offerings. Beatuiful setting in the main part of the hotel--but we booked an economy room which wasn't quite as nice. If I had to do it again I would spend $10 more to have a larger room. However, it was a fantastic deal and will be my place to stay at in San Diego from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: formalika
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great little motel. I stayed in a double queen room, which has a huge dual sink vanity area, plus a separate bathroom/sink/toilet/tub. Room was super clean, and comfortable for 3 people. Location is pretty industrial, but it is so close to everything, and if you don't have a car you can walk across the street to the train. The continental breakfast is above average, they give you tons of food waffles, fruit, cereals, pastries, more than the usu continental, and since it is included in the cost of the room, this makes it an even better deal. I saw the bungalow rooms by the pools, these seemed older & much smaller, I would reccommend staying in the bigger/new part of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: classicgirl_10
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a pleasant stay we enjoyed at the old town inn. From our travel book we weren't expecting much but once we arrived at the clean and well kept inn our expections were exceeded. With lots of familys staying there we felt very safe and at home. the staff was very helpful in directing us around this foreign town. The staff, Ed and John in paticular, were so patient and kind with the weary travelers. The pool was great and I even saw a hummingbird in the garden. I will deffinitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorGirl
Reviews.Content: We visited San Diego in July 2006 to attend the Comic-Con annual convention. This is the largest event of it's kind hosted in San Diego and all the rooms in the city get booked well in advance (approximately 100,000 visitors over 5 days). If you are planning a trip to the city in late July, be advised to secure a room well in advance!! We phoned the property directly to reserve a room and the friendly desk clerk described the accommodations to me and quoted a $76 rate but suggested we upgrade to a larger room for $110 a night. I have just returned and read that we probably were given a regular sized room as we had no cooking facilities as described in a review below... Live and learn. In any event, most reviews on TA are accurate. This is a motel facility on a busy 6 lane highway facing a munitions plant. That said, it was not noisy at all in our room which was not far from the street. We had a king-sized bed, a small desk, a sofa facing an armoire holding a television with basic cable channels. The room was well maintained and the bathroom and dressing area were very tidy. One gripe about most motels, the industrial carpet was not clean - so it's a good idea to bring slippers. The motel makes a great effort to create a pleasant atmosphere in an industrial area. Travel time to the airport is only 5 minutes but we heard no air traffic! The staff are all very friendly. The desk had ample help to facilitate check in for the large crowd as all rooms were sold out the entire weekend. As mentioned, there is a sunny breakfast room off the lobby featuring FREE cold cereals, muffins, bagels, and rolls. There were 2 toasters, a microwave and various spreads and jam. A bowl of fruit cup and 2 self-serve waffle grills seemed to fascinate many visitors. Most people helped themselves to a large bowl of apples and oranges "to go," though the hotel asks that all food be consumed on site. This free buffet exceeded our expecations... Parking is free and although we were concerned we would not get a spot upon our return late one evening, I think we got the last one. All in all, there is little fault to find with the property. We did not take the trolley, but the depot is close enough to walk easily from the hotel across the busy street. Folks attending a convention have a 5 minute drive or easy access via public transport. All in all, we would return to the Old Town Inn. I would suggest booking the least expensive room as I do believe most rooms are the same. Ask questions if you call the motel directly to relieve any uncertainty. This is a very simple, roadside motel with above average service and clean, safe accommodations. A very good budget option for business or families.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value but location?”
Reviews.Author: jet029
Reviews.Content: Last month for 2 nights we chose the Old Town Inn San Diego based on recommendations made by this forum. Location-wise, this hotel is definitely out of the way, but well within a very short and easy walking distance to Old Town San Diego and the S.D. Trolley station. Its location is less than ideal right in the middle of the heavy industrial sector of town facing the Sparwar plant and other industrial businesses. However, the hotel itself, a Spanish style L-shaped three storey motel-style building, is very attractive with a beautiful pool, free parking, excellent breakfast including make-your-own waffles and other breakfast goodies. There is a coin operated laundry. Our deluxe room came with 2 Queen-sized bed…very nice. It had a dataport connection but we used the free PC provided for guests located in the lobby (printing cost: 25¢ per sheet). In fact we used it to print out our Southwest Airlines boarding pass (Group A) for our flight to Las Vegas. This hotel rates are excellent taking into consideration the closeness to S.D. Old Town. Take note that this hotel is regularly featured in the discount coupon books that are found free of charge on sidewalk dispensers. Staff is friendly and helpful with suggestions for what to see and where to go. Excellent value. jet29

Reviews.Title: “The motel and rooms were nice, but the location is questionable.”
Reviews.Author: del3ose
Reviews.Content: We checked into the motel on June 29, 2006 for one night. The motel is not near a freeway exit from downtown San Diego. You need to exit and go about two miles on the Pacific Highway. The motel is located in an industrial area. There is nothing around it like stores or a restaurant, but if you drive there are many businesses within a five minute drive. You can walk to old town San Diego, but I would recommend doing it during daylight hours. The check in area was nice and the lady at the desk was sweet and smiled the whole time. There seemed to be some questionable people at the motel, but I felt better when I saw more families checking in and walking around the motel. I checked in to room 102. It was one room away from the main highway, but it was surprisingly quiet. The room was one for handicapped people so the bathroom was BIG. The room had two queen beds, a table, an armoire where the TV and clothes fit, a small desk, ironing board, coffeemaker, blow dryer and little items in case you forgot (shampoo, lotion, mouthwash, etc.). The one thing I did not like was that the vanity was in the bathroom. So you can not blow dry your hair or use the sink if someone else was in the bathroom. In the morning they had a breakfast room that was set up for “buffet style” food for hotel guests. You got to make your own waffles plus there were hard boiled eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, juice, coffee, milk and cereal. We did not use the pool, but we did notice it was enclosed within the motel; right next to the reception area. There was only one ice machine at the motel and it was centrally located on the second floor. The parking was tight. If there was a SUV it basically took up two spaces because it was so narrow. I don’t know if I would stay here again, but this was the only place I could find for under $100 in San Diego with a good review.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego with 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: berryd
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Old Town Inn with a 9 and 3 yr old. The hotel is great for the price and the kids loved the breakfast and the pool. The room was small (our fault for reserving the smallest room) but it was very clean. The beds were comfortable. No bathtub, just a shower. Overall, great hotel for the price! We will come back but reserve a room that is a little bit bigger. :) We walked to Old town one night and had dinner (great park area for kids to run around), went to Sea World the next day, and spent the 3rd night swimming with the kids. For dinner, we took the trolley (accross the street from hotel) to the gaslamp district ($4/person R/T). We almost went to a ballgame at the new Petco Park but we didn't plan very well.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozteddy
Reviews.Content: My thanks to the TripAdvisor contributors for suggesting this hotel. It was a great location within easy walking distance to Old Town, public transport and a 5 minute drive from Downtown and Seaworld. I would probably call it a Motel rather than Hotel (by my criteria) and my only grumble would be that we could hear the people in the room above us moving about (or practising long jump!!), so I would not want a ground floor room if I stay there again. The rooms were clean and well maintained, the staff very friendly and the pool although small was surrounded by garden and very pleasant. Breakfast is included in the rate and is a self serve affair with a good variety of cereals, muffins, waffles, fruit, juices etc. They also have a guest laundry which is a great bonus for people like us who were on a 3 week vacation. We dined at various restaurants in Old Town each night of our stay and felt completely safe walking to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “super value”
Reviews.Author: CGYFP
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money,everything was better than expected,helpfull staff,clean rooms,great breakfast (kids really enjoyed making there own waffles ).This hotel is located close to a busy highway but it is also located almost downtown,and right next door to Oldtown a short 5 min walk I did not find the noise from the nearby highway a problem,We all had a very pleaseant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kamabuki
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is a great Budget Hotel. The rooms were clean and well kept. The staff was very helpfull and freindly. They have a great morning breakfast. The downside is the noise. You can hear the conversations, tv's from the rooms next door. The traffic from the very busy Pacific Hwy is always a constant. With all things considered - would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is gross!!!”
Reviews.Author: Willie83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the advice of another travel forum and I wish we would of never listened to them. The motel is in the worst area that I could see in San Diego and we had our rental car broken into at our motel along with alot of homeless people sleeping right next door to the motel and it was very very noisy because of the trolley and you are under a busy freeway. For the price of $90 a night, we could of stayed in a better area of San Diego. There seems to be alot of night girls in the area trying to make there money. The motel is ok but the location is awful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well its a Motel and lets face it you usally cannot expect much from a Motel except a place to lay your head. Well we were pleasantly surprised to find a Motel with a nice clean room, great breakfast, warm pool, cheerful greetings and very helpful with directions and things to do. If you are looking for just a nice place to stay that is reasonable than this is it. It is not the Marriot (although I recieved better guest relations at the Inn than with most Marriots) so do not expect it, what it is is a great place to rest up and recoup for the next day. When we travel we are hardly at the hotel except to sleep and eat and the Old Town in satisfys this better than most. It is well located between Sea World (5min) the Zoo (10min) and Old Town just across the street relativly speaking. It is on a 6 lane road but we found no noise from the road to be bothersome. To summ it up Great place to stay cheaply with a fantastic continetal breakfast. Sincerly The Downeys Maryland

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, nice motel, but ...”
Reviews.Author: paulgAustin_TX
Reviews.Content:
Not a 5-star or top-10 hotel/motel. I think the problem is that people are normalizing the review based on the cost, but I'm not going to do that. If you're willing to put up with the few issues, then it's an awesome bargain. I would have given it 3.5 stars, but since I can't, I've rounded up. Most of the reviews (good and bad) are pretty much right on. First, the good: 1) As mentioned, great bargain ... ~ $100/night for a double queen deluxe 2) Very good location - walking distance to Old Town and the Trolley station; minutes from Sea World, downtown, the airport, and the Zoo 3) Great breakfast (as everyone mentions) - it can easily save you a lot of money if you normally eat a big breakfast with a family
4) Very clean and nice decorum in the rooms, lobby, and poolside Now the bad: 1) This is by far the noisiest hotel/motel we've ever stayed in. And we've stayed in all different types of places, from old boutique hotels in busy downtown areas to the cheapest Motel 6 by a busy highway. And this noise is all internal, not from the nearby highway. During the busy time when most rooms are occupied, you can hear everything above you and on both sides. Every footstep sounds like an elephant stampede. Every bath or shower sounds like Niagra Falls. You can even hear conversations, drawers opening/closing, and faucets being turned. And this was in the new section. Luckily my 5 year old sleeps through everything and we are usually up by 6:30, or we would have been even more annoyed. When I mentioned this to the desk person as we were checking out, she said we should have stayed on the 3rd floor. Perhaps they can pre-warn people if 3rd floor rooms are still available. 2) The pool is basically useless, exept for probably July/August. It is small, and even though it is heated (supposedly) to 82deg, it is freezing. The entire week we were there, we saw a total of 2 kids using it. Perhaps we are too use to 90deg+ lake temps in Texas. ;) 3) Only one desk person at any time, even during the busy weekends, can make for a long wait. All that said, we had a great 1 week trip and would recommend this motel for the budget conscious (and deep sleepers).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Exceeded Already High Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Front Desk: Staff was consistently very friendly, knowledgeable, and prepared to answer our questions. They seemed to appreciate our business! They provided their own info sheets on public transit, and mapped out some of the best restaurants within walking distance. Room: pleasant décor, perfectly clean. Beds were fine. Ours was an economy room, $58 in late April, so there was no microwave/blow dryer/fridge. Breakfast: Very clean, pleasant, indoor breakfast room, with waffles, variety of flavoured and plain bagels fresh each morning, cream cheese, jams, bread, various flavours of hot oatmeal pouches and cold cereals, pastries, muffins, apples, oranges, milk, juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Hot beverages were available all day and evening. Hotel Grounds: Nice landscaping, plants everywhere, a pretty fountain, and lights on the trees at night. Heated pool, looked clean, patio furniture to sit poolside. Location: Across the street (5 minute walk) from the Old Town Amtrak & Trolley/Bus Station (very good public transit system with frequent service to Sea World, downtown Amtrak station, Balboa Park, La Jolla). Old Town has many Mexican restaurants and shops, most within a 10-minute walk. The area appears to be fairly safe, even at night. The transit station seems to have security guards on duty most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for, a cheap place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: At a rate of around $60.00 per night, you cannot expect much from the Old Town Inn. So, I went with an open mind. The room we got was not located on the main grounds of the property, it was there older rooms, which I guess are the cheapest, they were located next door to the Inn. I first thought they were an apartment complex, but unfortunetely I was wrong. The room is very small with an even smaller shower stall. i mean I am 5'7, and had to bend over to get my head under the water. So if you envision taking a romantic shower with you significant other, than forget about it. We had a problem with one of the employees (Hanz) checking us in, he was just not the friendliest person in the world and the manager (Batrice) did say he was being trained for the day shift. We were given an upgrade to a room with a refrigerator and microwave which was great to keep some water. But, we found the freezer did not work when we bought some ice cream on night and the next moring we had a milk shake instead. So, if you get a fridge, I would not trust the freezer. The breakfast was very good, much more than you could ask for. Waffles were my favorite. Public Transportation was so close, this was my favorite part of the place, literally a 5 minute walk to the trolley, bus, and cab station. Which was great for us, since we took amtrak and used the trolley to go everywhere. All in all, The Old Town Inn was a decent place to stay, and I might stay here again for a cheap room. But if you can pay more than the $60.00 a night room, than I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Zahanoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Old town inn during a weekend getaway and we had a great time. The staff is freindly and helpfull and the room was clean and cozy. They had a very nice breakfast. The lobby and breakfast area were airy and the decor was warm and super clean. The pool area was a great place to lounge in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn--Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value. We paid $55.00-$65.00 a night for a one bed room. It appears that one area of the hotel might be newer than the complex that we stayed in, perhaps these rooms are nicer. The room itself was adequate, but I woul have preferred to pay a little more for a quieter place. The hotel is loud. There is significant street noise, it's located on a 4 lane road and you could hear a lot of noise between rooms. We were able to hear the people on both sides of us returning to the hotel at night and leaving in the morning. We were also able to hear the television in their room. Thank goodness we were trying to watch the same channel. The room was clean, but the finishings were sparse. For example, the towels were very thin, the bed was not very comfortable, there is only a shower stall not a tub, the lights in the room are turned on by pulling a string etc. None of these things are terrible so long as you are not expecting anything luxurious. The reception room was very sunny and tastefully decorated. In addition, the complimentary breakfast was a great surprise to us and more than adequate. They had a nice variety of dry cereals, muffins, bagels, fruit, and even waffle makers. The staff were usually cheery and pleasant. Although the woman who helped us at check-in was very slow and made no offer to hold our luggage or assist us in any way while we waited for our room be cleaned. We arrived at around 12:30 and check in wasn't until 3:00. We did not swim during out time here, but the pool area appears to be well kept although it's a bit small for the size of the hotel. The location is off a rather busy four lane road. It is near the Old Town area which is a fun way to spend an evening. There's great Mexican Food and many historic buildings. It's also near the Metro Station and a Trolley System of some sort. I would recommend taking one these forms of transportation to get downtown. The parking is rather difficult and pricey ($10-20).

Reviews.Title: “Sunlight or silence?”
Reviews.Author: valstock
Reviews.Content: Old Town Inn is a very good motel. Here is an advice: If you like daylight - avoid room 111. If you like silence - choose room 111. It´s situated in the inner corner behind the elevator so no daylight reaches in there. But it was by far the most silent room in our two weeks in California. We are non smokers and 111 is a smoking room, but we couldn´t notice any smell or so. Yes, the staff, especially this tall blondish guy (Ed?) is excellent. The breakfast is great, and the price is a bargain compared to other sites prices. A $85 motel is a bad, seedy place in e.g. Santa Monica. But Old Town inn is very clean and has a nice, small, pool area. The motel is far away from everything except for the train/trolley station and "Historic Old Town" (which I jogged through in seven minutes one early morning, it´s like a "wild west town" with small shops and restaurants and old houses). You can easily go by the trolley to downtown, but a car is needed to go to the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great”
Reviews.Author: FPCarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights recently to visit SeaWorld with our 2 sons and it worked out great. The GM checked us in and gave a great restaurant recommendation in Old Town (Old Town Mexican Cafe) which is walkable. The room wasn't fancy but was very nice and remarkably quiet given the location of the hotel. The waffle makers were a nice treat for breakfast. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town was adequate”
Reviews.Author: erc
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Old Town Inn for a couple of nights. Even though the reviews seemed over-the-top I was still not sure what to expect because of the 2 star rating. The staff was friendly and helpful, the grounds inviting, the rooms clean, the breakfast satisfying. So, yes, it was a nice place...FOR A MOTEL. We needed a room with 2 beds and were given the only available non-smoking room which had 1 bed with a sofa bed and a kitchen, which we didn't request nor need, but made the rate go up $20.00 more per night. Both beds were VERY uncomfortable and the kitchen was not stocked (i.e. plates, utensils, pans). Very close to Old Town, which we enjoyed, and Hotel Circle is less than 10 minutes away by car, where we found lots of stores and restaurants. Pho Cali Restaurant was a wonderful find. Bottom line...Was it more than we expected?-yes. Was it worth the 86.00/night rate we paid- no. Would we stay again- maybe, for a bargain rate.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemax
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, occupancy was at 100% due to Sporting event. Staff, Ed in particular, were fantastic and a wealth of knowledge. We had a deluxe double and the room was very clean and spacious. The pillow top bed was the best I have ever had in a Motel! Breakfast was cereals, fruit, muffins, bagels, toast and make yourself waffles with maple syryp and was delicious. My only comment back to the hotel was that the breakfast room wasn't really big enough to cater for the number of people staying, but as I said, they were at 100% full. I highly recommend this Motel

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tasjaw
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 3 days and found the staff to be very friendly. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was one of the better we have had. The pool was heated and in great shape. the location was very close to the attractions. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept San Diego secret!”
Reviews.Author: GoFlyNZ
Reviews.Content: This was easy to find because of it's excellent location and directions on thier website. Check in was fast and freindly and any questions were answered easily and maps provided. Our room was on the 2nd floor on the end and it was huge! Well appointed, it was clean and tidy and quiet. The only noise was from the rush hour traffic on the monday morning, but no problem here at weekends. The breakfast was awesome, there was a wide selection including fresh waffles which were easy to make, replenished frequently and everything was nice and hygenic. We could have spent longer here and would definitely return to this place when staying in San Diego again. If we continue to give it such fabulous reviews then it'll be full next time we want to return!

Reviews.Title: “Whoa now. It's not that good.”
Reviews.Author: ralfeez
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I realize not ALL rooms are created equally, not ALL staff are perfect, and not ALL weekends are ideal. The reviews on here made the Old Town Inn seem like the find of a lifetime. I was there less that 24 hours ago and just have to disagree. It isn't bad, it is just a so so place. It is in the middle of an industrial section of the city. Think of an old Motel 6 or a Super 8. Then add nice landscaping, a reasonable price, and old (but clean) rooms. There are very few other business close by. There is no onsite restaurant and only one restaurant about 1.5 blocks away only open for breakfast and lunch. No stores, no restaurants, no shopping, and really nothing worth seeing that is anywhere close to walking distance. If you have a car and are on a budget, then this isn't a bad place. Don't compare it to the other hotels that are in the middle of the action and near other sites or businesses. Really just average and believe me when I say, not any better than that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low budget place to stay in San Diego with a central location and excellent service this is it!!! Positive + Across the street from Old Town + Across the street from the public transport and tram + Nice sized rooms. Very clean and comfortable. + Awesome breakfast selection + Central location to attractions/San Diego + Very helpful staff. + AAA rates Negative - Located in a industrial area - Low amounts of noise from other rooms and roads - Heated pool, is not heated. - Little to no stores close by. Shops are 15min walk. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego who is conscious of money. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast fills you up for the whole day. The value for $$$ is excellent. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “excellent old town inn”
Reviews.Author: speedy55
Reviews.Content: this is a little gem in a wonderful part of san diego.initially i worried that we were in a remote location but it is only a stone throw's distance from old town. the rooms are clean and well maintained, but what sets it apart from other motels is the quality of staff. they were incredibly helpful and welcoming. the breakfast has a huge selection, with something to suit everyone. we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service - Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyFamilyVancouver
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a Family Suite and found the Old Town Inn to be a great place to stay. We were given a friendly greeting and everything was in order. The room was large and extremely clean. The only thing we really could complain about was the location. The hotel is located in an industrial area fairly close to the airport. This makes it somewhat noisy. For the price you won't find anything even close to it in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TGann
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Old Town Inn, San Diego for three nights. The hotel was really a great place to stay at an excellent price of $75 dollars a night. We stayed in a deluxe efficiency room which included a gas stove, microwave and a fridge. The continental breakfast was excellent, and included fresh fruit, cereal, juice, milk, coffee and tea and we were even able to make our own waffles using their waffle irons. They had free high-speed internet access in the lobby, but I was able to access it from my room several yards away. The pool was nice as well. The only noise that was somewhat a bother was when the neighboring rooms used their water. I could hear the noise in the pipes in my room rather clearly. Other than that, this was a great place to stay and at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Simply the best. Very courteous staff will help you in any way they can. Clean almost to a fault. We stayed in the least expensive room which accommodated only one queen bed but the mattress was very good and comfortable. Breakfast options are about the best for any inexpensive motel we've gone to. The location is very close to the Old Town trolley station -- consider buying a multi-day transit pass there. You can go to and from the airport by a slightly indirect route for very little money, but the transit passes are not available at the airport. You will need exact change for the bus fare if you take the bus/trolley from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After almost getting ripped off by a very shady car rental company just after landing in San Diego, we arrived at the hotel in a rotten mood. The smiling young lady (Kelly?) at the desk immediatly asked what was wrong. We told her and she gave us a small upgrade to our room to make us feel better. She keep smiling and chatting about where to eat, the easy access to public transportation if needed, and in seconds we were in a good mood again. The next morning, after having a nice free breakfast in the lobby, we told David the manager (who is also always smiling and seems to love his job) about how his thoughtful night shift worker lifted our spirits so quickly. He smiled (did I mention that everyone at this place smiles all the time?) and said that he does not hire experianced hotel workers. He hires people based on having a helpful happy attitude and then trains them on how to perform the job. What a great concept! Sure the Hotel is a very good value, but it is the great staff there that helped get us back into the spirit of our vacation. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It is located kind of out of the way on a main thorougfare, but you can quickly travel downtown in no time. We were not bothered at all by traffic noise. The rooms were large and clean. Had a comfortable bed, couch, nice tv, large bathroom. . . just great for the price. Good breakfast in the morning too. Great price! Clean room! No problems!

Reviews.Title: “Clean - Beautiful Landscaping - Friendly Service - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn is well worth staying at for any visit to San Diego. The staff are friendly and very helpful. The pool is within a courtyard. A very pretty hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. Our room even had two sinks, a large counter, fridge and microwave. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor.com and was not disappointed. As stated in previous reviews and as we can confirm, it is close to a busy road but the noise was not loud at all (our room was the second room next to the busy road) and we were pleasantly surprised that it was quiet. The breakfast was great -- we loved the waffles made in a waffle iron as well as the freshly boiled eggs. This hotel is located in an industrial area but it felt very safe. The rates were very affordable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Friendly People”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old Town Inn over the Christmas holiday. Very clean room, good pillows and good bed. Having a frig and microwave is a bonus, also. The front desk staff is very friendly. The grounds are absolutely beautiful with the flowers and palms. Breakfast has a lot of variety, including waffles that you make yourself. Thanks and we hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mid Range Hotel I have Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: saint82
Reviews.Content: This place was great. From the beautiful landscaping, to the immaculate and charming lobby, to the most helpful staff I have run into in a long time, this place was an absolute joy. The location was very convenient for both car travel and public transportation. It was about 10 minutes from downtown and the same from Sea World. The front desk even provided a one sheet information guide to every attraction that you could imagine. We used it, and all the directions were correct. The room was large and very comfortable. The next time that I am in San Diego I would not hesitate to stay here, and such a bargain. Did I mention that the front desk staff were wonderful?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff-great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was truly amazed by this place. From the moment you walk in to the time you check out, you are totally bowled over. The place is gorgeous - wonderful pool, great plantings. And the staff was sooo helpful and informative - Doug at the front desk gave us information on where to eat, what to see and is wonderfully fuuny - this guy is a gem as are the gals who run the breakfast - Esperanza and Mailia (sp?). The hotel is very clean and very central to everything in towm. I would very highly recommend this place, but I really don't want too many people to know about!!

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chicago_traveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night when visiting Old Town section of San Diego. It is clean and quiet, and is a five minute (or less) walk from Old Town. I stayed on a weekend and the hotel was full; pretty much the normal crowd - middle class families & couples, and seniors. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Inn, San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Old Town Inn had been recommended to us by a personal friend who lived in San Diego a few years ago. When He travels back to see a son, he ALWAYS stays at this Inn.
